This drill enhances passing accuracy, spatial awareness, and teamwork by encouraging players to use the four corner players as outlets to maintain possession. It also develops defensive pressure and quick transitions.














4v4+4 Corner Rondo


Rondo drill, 4v4+4 rondo, possession soccer, transition play, passing, small-sided game


A high-intensity possession drill that incorporates quick transitions, movement, and decision-making by using four corner players as support in a 25x25-yard grid.
setup_text:
• Field Size: 25x25 yards, marked by cones
• Players: 12 total (3 teams of 4 players)
• Roles:
• Red (4 players): Positioned at the four corners as neutral possession players
• Blue (4 players): Competes inside the grid against the red team
• Yellow (4 players): Competes inside the grid against the blue team
instructions_text:
• The blue and yellow teams play 4v4 inside the grid, maintaining possession.
• The red team players positioned at each corner are neutral support players.
• The team in possession can pass to any of the four corner players, who must quickly pass the ball back to the same team.
• The defending team works to win possession and immediately transitions to attacking play, using the corner players for support.
• The game flows continuously, with quick ball movement and positional adjustments.
• Play in 3-5 minute rounds, then rotate roles.
variations_text:
• Touch Restriction: Limit inside players to two-touch play for quicker decision-making.
• Corner Pass Rule: Require a team to use at least one corner player before scoring a set number of passes.
• Directional Play: Assign a target corner that teams must reach before switching play.
• Man-Marking Challenge: Defenders must track specific players for increased pressure.
• Timed Possession: Teams must complete 6-8 passes within a set time to earn points.
coaching_points_text:
• This rondo drill enhances passing combinations, positioning, and defensive pressing while reinforcing possession play under game-like pressure.
• Quick Ball Circulation: Encourage fast, accurate passing to shift defenders.
• Off-the-Ball Movement: Players should adjust positioning to create passing angles.
• Using the Corners Wisely: Teach players to use the corner support to relieve pressure.
• Defensive Organization: The defending team must press as a unit to force turnovers.
• Transition Speed: Teams should quickly adjust from attacking to defending roles.

name: 4v4+4 Continuous Transition Rondo
description:
This drill enhances quick decision-making, possession retention, and defensive pressing. Players develop composure under pressure, transition speed, and teamwork through a continuous cycle of possession and defending.














4v4+4 Continuous Transition Rondo


Rondo drill, 4v4+4, possession soccer, transition play, pressing, small-sided game


A dynamic possession rondo emphasizing quick transitions, pressing, and positional awareness in a 10x20-yard space with rotating roles.
setup_text:
• Field Size: Two adjacent 10x10-yard grids (total 10x20 yards) marked by 6 cones
• Players: 12 total (3 teams of 4 players)
• Roles:
• Yellow (4 players): Non-rotating possession team (two in the middle, two on end lines)
• Red (4 players): Starts as outside possession team on the sidelines
• Blue (4 players): Starts as the inside defenders
instructions_text:
• The yellow team (4 players) and the red team (4 players) maintain possession using quick passes.
• The blue team (4 players) applies defensive pressure inside the grid to win the ball.
• If the blue team wins possession, they must quickly pass to an outside yellow player and transition to the possession team outside the grid.
• The red team, having lost possession, immediately moves inside the grid to defend.
• The drill continues fluidly, with teams transitioning between possession and defense without stopping play.
• Play in 3-5 minute rounds, focusing on maintaining tempo and quick transitions.
• Rotate each team as the possession team.
variations_text:
• Touch Restriction: Limit possession players to two touches max.
• Man-Marking Challenge: Defenders must track specific players to increase defensive intensity.
• Time-Limited Possession: Require possession teams to complete 6-8 passes before switching play.
• Extra Defender: Add a neutral defensive player to make ball retention harder.
• Directional Play: Designate one end line as the attacking side where possession must be played into before scoring a point.
coaching_points_text:
• This drill improves technical passing, defensive awareness, and transition play, creating a high-tempo environment that simulates real-game scenarios.
• Quick Transitions: Players must react instantly when roles switch.
• First-Touch Passing: Encourage sharp, precise one- or two-touch passing.
• Movement Off the Ball: Players should constantly adjust their positioning to create passing lanes.
• Defensive Pressing: Defenders must work as a unit to force turnovers quickly.
• Communication: Players must talk to organize their transitions and support teammates.

name: 4v4+3 Continuous Transition Rondo
description:
This drill develops quick decision-making, first-touch passing, defensive pressing, and transition play. Players learn to maintain possession under pressure while reacting instantly to role changes when possession shifts.














4v4+3 Continuous Transition Rondo


Rondo drill, 4v4+3, possession soccer, transition play, pressing, small-sided game


A high-intensity rondo focusing on quick transitions, possession play, and defensive pressing in a 10x20-yard area with rotating roles.
setup_text:
• Field Size: Two adjacent 10x10-yard grids (total 10x20 yards) marked by 6 cones
• Players: 11 total (3 possession players, 2 teams of 4)
• Roles:
• Yellow (3 players): Always in possession (one inside, two on end lines)
• Red (4 players): Starts as outside possession team on the sidelines
• Blue (4 players): Starts as an inside defenders
instructions_text:
• The red team (4 players) and the yellow team (3 players) maintain possession, using quick passing.
• The blue team (4 players) applies defensive pressure inside the grid to win the ball.
• If the blue team wins possession, they must quickly pass to an outside player, transitioning to the new possession team.
• Having lost possession, the red team immediately moves inside to defend.
• The game continues fluidly, with teams transitioning between possession and defending without stopping.
• Play in 3-5 minute rounds, emphasizing continuous movement and quick transitions.
• Rotate each team as the possession team.
variations_text:
• Touch Restriction: Limit possession players to two touches max.
• Man-Marking Challenge: Defenders must track specific players to increase defensive intensity.
• Time-Limited Possession: Require possession teams to complete 6-8 passes before switching play.
• Extra Defender: Add a neutral defensive player to increase difficulty for possession teams.
• Directional Play: Designate one end line as the attacking side where possession must be played into before scoring a point.
coaching_points_text:
• This drill enhances possession skills, defensive reactions, and team communication while simulating real-game transitions in a controlled, high-tempo environment.
• Focus on:
• Quick Transitions: Players must react instantly when possession changes.
• First-Touch Passing: Encourage sharp, precise one- or two-touch passing.
• Support Play: Off-ball movement is crucial for creating passing angles.
• Defensive Pressing: Defenders should work as a unit to force mistakes and win possession quickly.
• Communication: Players must constantly talk to organize transitions and maintain possession.

name: 1v1 Reaction Gate Challenge
description:
This drill enhances 1v1 attacking and defending skills by training quick decision-making, reaction speed, and close ball control. Attackers learn to use deception, while defenders focus on anticipation and body positioning.














1v1 Reaction Gate Challenge


1v1 soccer drill, reaction speed, dribbling, defending, body feints


A fast-paced 1v1 drill where attackers use fakes and body feints to beat defenders and dribble through one of two gates while defenders react to prevent the goal.
setup_text:
• Field Size: Approx. 30x30 feet (diamond-shaped)
• Players: Two lines (attackers with a ball & defenders)
• Gates: Two small gates using training sticks or cones, placed equally between the two lines, about 30 feet apart
• Ball Supply: One ball per attacker
instructions_text:
• The first attacker in line dribbles forward and quickly chooses which gate to attack.
• The first defender in line steps out and tries to stop the attacker from dribbling through either gate.
• Attackers use feints, changes of pace, and body movement to get past the defender.
• Attackers can change gates to attack the other gate if the defender has effectively defended a gate.
• If the attacker successfully dribbles through a gate, they earn 1 point.
• If the defender wins possession or forces the attacker away from the gates, they earn 1 point.
• Players rotate after each round, and the first team to 10 points wins that round.
variations_text:
• Weak Foot Challenge: Attackers must use their weaker foot when dribbling.
• Time Limit: Attackers must attempt to score within 5 seconds.
• Bonus Points: Award an extra point for attackers who successfully use a skill move before scoring.
• 2v1 Variation: Introduce a second attacker to create a passing option and force defenders to make split-second decisions.
• This drill is excellent for sharpening individual skills and reaction speed while keeping players engaged in a competitive setting.
coaching_points_text:
• Attackers should use explosive changes of direction and speed to throw off defenders.
• Encourage creative dribbling moves, such as scissors, step-overs, or shoulder feints.
• Defenders must stay low, react quickly, and use proper foot positioning to force the attacker away.
• Emphasize quick transitions after each play to keep the intensity high.
• Keep players engaged by reinforcing competition and rewarding effort.

name: 3v3, 4-Goal Small-Sided Game Funino
description:
This small-sided shooting and finishing game is a great shooting drill that focuses on shooting and finishing.














Small-Sided Shooting and Finishing Game


Small-Sided, Shooting, finishing, goal scoring, soccer, drill, game, practice, training


This small-sided shooting and finishing game is a great shooting drill that focuses on shooting and finishing.
setup_text:
• Create a small area, approximately the size of the penalty area (18X40 yards), and mark the field's center point with cones.
• Taper each of the sidelines towards the goals on each end of the penalty area. This shape will help avoid bad shooting angles.
• Organize players in a 4v2 (four defenders and two attackers) in each half of the field.
• Restrict players to stay on the side of the grid they were initially placed.
• Place spare soccer balls near each of the goals for quick retrieval and quick restarts.
instructions_text:
• The defenders must shoot from their half of the field.
• The forwards should follow any shots from the defenders and finish any rebounds.
• If the goalkeeper recovers the shot, they quickly distribute the ball to their defensive players, and the play continues.
• If the shot flys over the goal, a new ball is retrieved from behind the goal, and play should resume quickly.
• Players are encouraged to take half chances and limit the number of touches before shooting.
• Forwards should follow any shot for rebounds.
variations_text: • Place a restriction on the number of touches. Allow defenders to have 3-touch and forward's only 1-touch. This will encourage quick shots and more opportunities.
coaching_points_text:
• Players should be instructed to take shots. Players miss 100% of all shots not taken!
• Forwards need to be reminded to follow any rebound and get in the keeper’s face.
• The number of touches should be limited to take quick shots.

name: Hexagonal Rondo
description:
The Hexagonal Rondo drill focuses on quick passing and movement within a six-sided grid, emphasizing control and spatial awareness. Players work to maintain possession by creating passing angles and exploiting gaps in the defensive shape. The objective is to enhance technical precision, quick decision-making, and fluid team coordination.














Hexagonal Rondo


hexagonal rondo, hex rondo, hexagon rondo, hex soccer rondo, soccer rondo


The Hexagonal Rondo is a fantastic way to enhance players' understanding of spatial awareness, quick decision-making, and teamwork in a more dynamic passing environment.
setup_text:
• Use the cones to create a hexagonal shape (6 sides). Each side should be around 5-7 yards long, depending on the skill level and number of players.
• Divide players into two groups of 5 players each. Use pinnies to differentiate the teams.
• Place three players from each team around the outside of the hexagon, alternating colors on each side of the hex. These players must stay on the hexagon's sides and are restricted to their side.
• Two players from each team will play as a 2v2 inside the hexagon, with the three supporting players outside the hexagon. The players inside the hexagon are free to move about the inside of the hexagon.
instructions_text:
• The coach starts the game by passing a ball to one of the teams.
• The objective is for this team to keep possession by using their two teammates in the middle of the hexagon and their teammates positioned around it.
• The two defenders on the other team will attempt to win or intercept the ball.
• If the defenders win the ball, they quickly play it to their teammates to maintain possession.
• After a minute or two of high-intensity possession, rotate the inside players with the outside players.
• The drill should be fast-paced, with quick turnovers and transitions between attack and defense.
variations_text:
• Limit touches to one-touch passing for more advanced players to speed up the game and improve ball control under pressure.
• Add more inside players to increase the difficulty for the attackers.
• Reduce the size of the hexagon to create tighter spaces, requiring quicker decision-making and sharper passes.
• Introduce a scoring system in which attackers gain a point for every consecutive 5 passes completed without interception, increasing the drill's competitive edge.
coaching_points_text:
• Attacking players should constantly move along their side of the hexagon to create better passing angles and to receive the ball.
• Encourage quick passing and movement from the attackers to force the defenders to work hard and prevent them from winning the ball.
• Focus on quick passing and encourage players to use the outside foot to make smoother passes along the hexagon.
• Encourage head-up play to ensure players are always aware of the defenders' positions and the passing options available.
• Teach players to move into space after passing the ball to open up better angles for receiving.
• Defenders should work together to press the ball and anticipate passing lanes to intercept.

name: 4-Goal Game
description:
The 4-Goal Game drill simulates match conditions, encouraging players to switch the point of attack while maintaining team shape. This drill focuses on quick ball circulation to retain possession and balance the field to prevent counterattacks. The objective is to develop players' spatial awareness, movement, and strategic positioning under game-like pressure.














4-Goal Game


4-goal soccer game


The 4-Goal Game provides a dynamic and engaging way to teach players key concepts like spatial awareness, teamwork, and quick transitions.
setup_text:
• Create a rectangular field with dimensions around 25x35 yards (adjust based on the number of players and their skill level).
• Place two goals near the corners of the long side of the field (totaling four goals, two for each team to defend and attack).
• Divide players into two teams. A 3v3, 4v4, or 5v5 setup works well for this drill.
• Each team defends two goals and attacks the two goals on the opposite side.
instructions_text:
• The teams start in the middle of the field, and the coach plays a ball to begin the game.
• The objective is to score in one of the opponent's two goals while defending both of your own.
• Players can score in either of the two goals they are attacking, which forces the defending team to be aware of multiple threats and cover both goals.
• The game focuses on quick transitions between defending and attacking, as the ball can switch directions rapidly.
• When a goal is scored, restart the game quickly by having the coach play in another ball.
• Rotate players frequently to keep everyone involved and ensure each player gets practice in attacking and defending situations.
variations_text:
• Limit touches for attacking players (e.g., two-touch maximum) to force quicker decision-making and movement.
• Add neutral players (jokers) to create a numbers-up situation, giving the attacking team an advantage.
• Increase the number of players (e.g., 6v6 or 7v7) to work on positioning in larger spaces.
• Change the goal sizes to increase or decrease the challenge for attacking and defending.
coaching_points_text:
• Attacking players must decide quickly which goal to target based on the defensive setup.
• Defending players must communicate and position themselves effectively to cover both goals and block passing lanes.
• Encourage quick decision-making when attacking; players should assess which goal is more open and position themselves accordingly.
• Focus on defensive positioning and communication. Players should work together to cover both goals and prevent the attackers from having easy options.
• Teach players to transition quickly from defense to attack and vice versa.
• Promote creativity in attack, encouraging players to try different ways to create space and open up a goal-scoring opportunity.

name: 3v1 Transition Rondo
description:
The 3v1 Transition Rondo drill emphasizes quick combination passing to unbalance the defender and shift the point of attack to an adjacent grid. This exercise challenges the defender to transition rapidly between areas, enhancing their ability to react under pressure. The focus is on sharp passing and strategic movement to exploit defensive weaknesses.














3v1 Transition Rondo


3v1 Transition Rondo


The 3v1 Transition Rondo focuses on quick combination passing to off-balance the defender and switch the point attack to the adjacent grid, forcing the defender to transition into the next area quickly.
setup_text:
• Create two adjacent 7x7 yard grids, ultimately creating a 7x14 yard grid split in the middle.
• Divide players into groups of 5.
• Four attacking players start outside the four sides of the grid.
• Place a defender inside one of the grids.
• The two outside attackers on the long side of the grid must shift to the grid with the ball.
instructions_text:
• The play starts with an attacking player passing to one of the three players who play a 3v1 rondo against the defender.
• Players can shift the ball to the adjacent grid at any point to the player at the end line, and the players along the outside must quickly shift to their grid to offer good supporting positions and angles.
• The defender also shits into the other grid playing a 3v1 rondo in this grid.
• Play continues until the defender wins the ball, or for some allotted time, such as 2 minutes, then rotate.
variations_text:
• Add another defender
• to increase the challenge, creating a 3v2+1 scenario.
• Reduce the grid size
• to 5X5 yards to force quicker decision-making and sharper passes.
• Limit touches
• for the attackers (e.g., two-touch maximum) to speed up play.
coaching_points_text:
• Encourage quick, accurate passing
• and movement off the ball to create passing options.
• Focus on quick transitions
• between attack and defense to improve reaction time.
• Teach players to think ahead,
• anticipating where the ball might go next.
• Emphasize communication
• among players to maintain possession and identify when to transition.

name: 4v4 Scrimmage to Mini-Goals
description:
The objective of a 4v4 soccer scrimmage to mini-goals is to replicate the dynamics of a full-sided game in a smaller, more controlled environment. This format encourages players to focus on quick decision-making, positioning, and maintaining possession under pressure, as well as improving their ability to transition between attacking and defending. The mini-goals emphasize accuracy and composure in front of the goal, helping players develop finishing skills without the presence of a goalkeeper.














4v4 Scrimmage to Mini-Goals


soccer scrimmage 4v4 to goals


The 4v4 scrimmage to mini-goals is to improve quick decision-making, positioning, and finishing accuracy in a small-sided game, emphasizing both attack and defense.
setup_text:
• Mark the Field
• : Set up a small field, approximately 30x20 yards, depending on the age and skill level of the players. Use cones to define the boundaries.
• Place the Mini-Goals
• : Position two mini-goals on each end line of the field, centered along the width. Ensure there is enough space for the players to move around the goals.
• Divide the Teams
• : Split the players into two teams of four. If there are extra players, rotate them regularly or set up a second game.
• Explain the Rules
• : Brief the players on the basic rules—no goalkeepers, regular throw-ins, and the importance of teamwork, passing, and positioning.
instructions_text:
• Start the Game
• : Place the ball in the center of the field and have one team kick off. Encourage both teams to focus on quick passing, moving off the ball, and accurate shooting at the mini-goals.
• Manage the Game
• : Monitor the game, guiding positioning and movement. Encourage positive play and emphasize the objectives of quick decision-making and teamwork.
• Rotate Players (if needed)
• : If you have more than eight players, rotate them in after a set time (e.g., every 5 minutes) to keep everyone engaged and active.
variations_text:
• Limit the number of touches
• Teams can only score after x passes
• All four players must touch the ball before scoring
coaching_points_text:
• Positioning
• : Encourage players to maintain good spacing and avoid bunching up, creating passing lanes and options.
• Communication
• : Remind players to talk to each other, calling for the ball and directing teammates.
• Quick Passing
• : Emphasize the importance of quick, accurate passes to keep possession and exploit gaps in the defense.
• Movement Off the Ball
• : Encourage players to constantly move into space, making themselves available for passes.
• Transition
• : Focus on quick transitions between attacking and defending; when the ball is lost, immediate pressure should be applied to win it back.
• Decision-Making
• : Guide players on when to pass, dribble, or shoot, fostering good decision-making under pressure.
• Defensive Shape
• : Ensure players understand the importance of staying compact defensively and working as a unit to block passing lanes.
• Finishing
• : Emphasize composure and accuracy when shooting at the mini-goals, aiming for the corners to increase scoring chances.
• Pressure the Ball
• : Instruct players to apply immediate pressure on the opponent with the ball to force mistakes and regain possession.
• Positive Reinforcement
• : Provide positive feedback on good plays, encouraging creativity and effort on both sides of the ball.

name: Stop and Turn Dribbling Relay Race
description:
Introduce a competitive element with the Stop and Turn Soccer Dribbling Relay Race, emphasizing stopping, turning, and directional changes. This drill reinforces quick transitions and sharpens players' ability to control the ball during directional shifts. The objective is to improve precision and speed in executing turns under pressure.














Stop and Turn Dribbling Relay Race


stop turn soccer dribbling relay race


The Stop and Turn Soccer Dribbling Relay Race adds more competition and focus to stopping, turning, and changing direction.
setup_text:
• Organize players into groups of 2-3 players with one ball between the players.
• Set up a channel for each group about 5 yards wide and 7-10 yards long.
• Players will start at one end of the channel between the cones.
instructions_text:
• At the coach's command, the first player will dribble the ball to the end of the channel, stop it, turn, and return it to the next player in line.
• The next player will continue this sequence until all players have performed the down and back movement five times.
• The team to finish first is declared the winning group.
• Play five sequences focusing on stopping the ball, turning, and changing direction.
variations_text: • Limit the turn to a specific turn such as pull-back or turn with the inside or outside of the foot.
coaching_points_text:
• Close control to stop the ball quickly.
• Turn to avoid danger and return the ball in control.
• Start talking about pull-backs, turning with the inside and outside of the foot.

name: Dribbling Through Gates Competition
description:
Develop players' dribbling skills by challenging them to navigate through multiple gates within a 1-minute timeframe. This drill emphasizes quick decision-making and ball control under pressure. The goal is to enhance agility and precision while maintaining speed during dribbling.














Dribbling Through Gates Competition


soccer dribbling through gates


This soccer dribbling drill will focus on soccer dribbling skills while the players compete to pass through as many gates as they can in 1 minute.
setup_text:
• In a 25X20-yard area, using training sticks or cones, randomly set up 2-yard gates around.
• All of the players start in the area with a ball.
instructions_text:
• At the coach's command, the players race around the area, collecting a point every time they dribble through a gate.
• The player must yell their score as they dribble through the gate.
• The player must dribble through all of the gates before they can return to the gate.
• At the end of one minute, the coach will ask the players for a count and declare the winner.
variations_text:
• Increase the time frame of each competition
• Increase or decrease the area between the gates
coaching_points_text:
• The race will encourage players to dribble at a faster pace.
• Encourage the players to get their heads up to find the next gate quickly.
• The ball is close and in control
• Encourage players to maneuver the ball with all parts of their foot.

name: Simple Obstacle Course
description:
This simple obstacle course is fun for young players and focuses on agility, dribbling, and scoring goals. This simple, fun obstacle course develops young players' agility, dribbling, and goal-scoring abilities. This drill sharpens dribbling technique and enhances coordination while navigating through obstacles. The focus is on building control and precision under dynamic conditions.














Simple Obstacle Course


agility, dribble, and shooting, obstacle course


This is a simple obstacle course for younger players to focus on agility, dribbling, and shooting.
setup_text:
• Set up an obstacle course using cones.
• Create a starting point by placing a cone about 3 yards from where you will place the first "hurdle obstacle." The hurdle can be short or tall cones or an agility hurdle.
• Three yards from the starting cone, set 3-5 hurdle obstacles about 1-yard apart.
• Using training sticks or cones, create a line of 4 to 6 sticks approximately 3 yards apart. Closer for more skilled dribblers.
• Set a Pugg or small soccer goal about 8-10 yards from the last training stick.
• Each player starts with a soccer ball at the beginning of the course.
instructions_text:
• Players begin at the start of the obstacle course with their ball.
• On the coach's signal, the first player passes to the coach and performs some agility technique over or around the hurdles.
• When the player reaches the end of the hurdles, the coach passes the ball back to the player, who slalom dribbles through the set of training sticks.
• Next, the player will dribble a few touches and have a shot on goal.
• The player should collect their ball and return to the starting point.
• Encourage players to use both feet and different parts of the foot to maneuver the ball.
variations_text: • Make it a competition by counting the times the players score
coaching_points_text:
• Encourage players to use both feet and different parts of the foot to dribble
• Encourage players to keep the ball close when navigating around the sticks
• Teach players to look up as much as possible
• Emphasize quick light touches to maintain control

name: Dribbling and Passing Warm-up Drill
description:
This is a passing warm-up drill that is a great start to every practice and before a game. Players will get a lot of touches on the ball and can focus on receiving and passing while getting in a good warm-up.














Passing Warm-up Drill


Passing Warm-up Drill


This is a passing warm-up drill that is a great start to every practice and before a game.
setup_text:
• Split the team into groups of two players with one ball per group.
• Set cones up creating a 5-yard passing lane about 10 yards apart.
• Set a different color cone about 5-yards from the passing lane creating a triangle.
• Players position themselves between the passing lane across from their partner.
instructions_text:
• In this warmup drill, run through a few of these variations for 3-4 minutes each.
• Players start with two-touch passes to one another. Players should be on the balls of their feet and moving.
• Players play in two-touches, but this time, immediately after making a pass, the passer alternates moving around the cones to their right and left.
• Players play in two-touches; immediately after making a pass, the passer touches their chest to the ground and quickly returns to their feet to receive the next pass.
• Players play in two-touches; immediately after making a pass, the passer turns and runs around the cone behind them and check-in to the middle of the cones to receive the next pass.
• Players play in two-touches; immediately after making a pass, the passer touches their butts to the ground and quickly returns to their feet to receive the next pass.
• Players play in two-touches; immediately after making a pass, the passer moves backward to the cone and checks-in to the middle of the cones to receive the next pass.
• Players play in one-touch passes.
variations_text: • Be creative and add other activities to mix things up.
coaching_points_text:
• Quality first touches, keeping the ball in front of the players.
• Communication between the two players.
• Good pace on the pass
• Good accuracy of the pass

name: 4v2 Rondo
description:
The 4v2 Rondo is a great soccer possession game to work on passing, angles of support, and movement off the ball to maintain possession.














4v2 Rondo


4v2 Rondo, 4 versus 2 Rondo, 4 vs 2 Rondo


The 4v2 Rondo is a great soccer possession game to work on passing, angles of support, and movement off the ball to maintain possession.
setup_text:
• Create a 10X10-yard area.
• Position four possession players outside the grid with one ball.
• Position two defenders inside the area.
• One possession player will start with the ball.
• Balls should be placed near the grid for quick restarts if the ball goes out of the area.
instructions_text:
• The four possession players pass and move to keep possession from the defending players.
• Players without the ball must support the player with the ball by giving them early support and good passing angles.
• The two defenders will attempt to intercept passes by working as a team to close down passing lanes and pressure the player with the ball.
• As the defender wins the ball, the ball can be played back to the attackers.
• Defenders can keep track of intercepted passes and used for scoring.
• Play will continue for two minutes before rotating the defenders.
variations_text:
• A point is awarded to the possession players after splitting the defenders
• A point is awarded to the possession players after x number of passes
• Rotate defenders after winning the ball x number of times
• Rotate defenders after 2 minutes
• Rotate defenders after winning the ball
• Limit touches to 1 or 2-touches
coaching_points_text:
• Early movement to quickly support players with the ball
• Create passing lanes by supporting players in good angles
• Good passing angles
• Good body positioning open to the field to play with speed
• Passes must be crisp and to feet
• Proper weight and type of pass

name: Three-Cone Passing Drill
description:
The three-cone passing drill focuses on passing, awareness, and movement after the pass. This is a great warmup to focus on passing technique and movement after the pass.














Three-Cone Passing Drill


three cone soccer passing drill


This is a soccer passing drill that will focus on passing and moving after the pass.
setup_text:
• Create an 8-yard triangle using three cones.
• Have two players start on one of the three cones, leaving one empty.
• One player starts with the ball.
instructions_text:
• As players pass the ball, they must move to the open cone.
• As the passing player moves to the open cone, his cone becomes open and available for the next passer.
• Play continues for 2 minutes.
variations_text:
• Increase or decrease the size of the field
• Limit the touches to 1-touch passing
• Add a combination or 1-2 pass
coaching_points_text:
• Good passing technique
• Crisp passes
• Good weight of passes
• Movement immediately after the pass
• Play in 2 touch

name: Four-Cone Passing Drill
description:
This four-cone passing drill focuses on soccer passing technique and movement after the pass. This is a great passing warm-up drill or a good start to a passing session.














Four-Cone Passing Drill


soccer passing and moving drill


This is a soccer passing drill that focuses on passing and movement.
setup_text:
• Create a 12X12 yard grid using cones.
• Have three players start on one of the four cones, leaving one empty.
• One player starts with the ball.
instructions_text:
• As players pass the ball to one of the other two teammates, the passing player moves to the open cone.
• As the player moves to the open cone, his cone becomes open and available for the next passer.
• Play continues for 2 minutes.
variations_text:
• Increase or decrease the size of the field
• Limit the touches to 1-touch passing
• Add a combination or 1-2 pass
coaching_points_text:
• Good passing technique
• Crisp passes
• Good weight of passes
• Movement immediately after the pass
• Play in 2-touch

name: Six-Cone Passing Drill
description:
The six-cone passing drill focuses on passing, awareness, and movement after the pass. This is a great warmup or to focus on passing technique and movement after the pass.














Six-Cone Passing Drill


six cone soccer passing drill


This is a soccer passing drill that focuses on passing, movement, and awareness after the pass.
setup_text:
• Create a 15 X 25-yard rectangle using six cones.
• Have five players start on one of the six cones, leaving one empty.
• One player starts with the ball.
instructions_text:
• As players pass the ball, they must move to the open cone.
• As the passing player moves to the open cone, his cone becomes open and available for the next passer.
• Play continues for 2 minutes.
variations_text:
• Increase or decrease the size of the field
• Limit the touches to 1-touch passing
• Add a combination or 1-2 pass
coaching_points_text:
• Good passing technique
• Crisp passes
• Good weight of passes
• Movement immediately after the pass
• Play in 2 touch

name: Four-Corner Shielding Drill
description:
This is a great drill for teaching the basics of shielding as it focuses on positioning your body between the ball and the defender to protect the ball.














Four-Corner Shielding Drill


Soccer Shielding, How to Shield in Soccer


This drill teaches players how to shield in soccer. It's a good soccer drill for teaching the basics of shielding.
instructions_text:
• The coach will yell out a number of the corner, and that defender will enter the grid and attempt to poke the ball away from the center-shielding player.
• In the first iteration, do not allow the shielding player to touch the ball and simply focus on using their body to keep the defender off the ball.
• The shielding player should quickly position their body between the ball and the defender in an attempt to keep the ball from the defender.
• If the shielding player is able to keep the defender from touching the ball for 5 seconds, they receive a point.
• If the defender knocks the ball away, they should play the ball back to the center player and return to their corner.
• The players return to their position, and the coach calls out another number.
• Let all of the players have a chance to be the shielding player.
• Keep track of points where the player with the highest point count in their grid wins after all players have a chance to be the shielding player.
setup_text:
• Create a 12x12 grid with 5 players per grid.
• Four players stand at each of the four corners of the grid while the fifth player starts in the middle with a ball.
• Number each of the four players on the corners 1-4.
• Create as many grids as needed for the number of players, as multiple grids can be run simultaneously.
variations_text:
• Allow the shielding player to move the ball around to keep their body between the ball and the defender.
• The coach can call out two numbers to increase the difficulty.
coaching_points_text:
• Position the body sideways between the ball and the defender
• Knees slightly bent
• Arms up and away from their body, bent at the elbows
• Arm closest to the defender touching the defender to help hold off the defender
• Wide stance and the ball held with the outside foot farthest from the defender
• Ability to move the ball with the bottom, inside, outside, and top of both feet
• Ability to spin out of pressure if the defender commits to defending a single direction

name: 2v2 + 1 to Two Goals
description:
This is a 2v2 + 1 attacking soccer game is played to two goals with a free attacker on the end line between the two goals. This game focuses on playing the ball forward to your target player before going to goal.














2v2 + 1 to Two Goals


2v2+1, Two vs Two Plus One; 2v2 attacking soccer game


This is a 2v2 + 1 attacking soccer game is played to two goals with a free attacker on the end line between the two goals. This game focuses on playing the ball forward to your target player before going to goal.
setup_text:
• Create a grid approximately 25X40 yards.
• Place two mini-goals on the longer sides of the field.
• Split the team into two groups.
• Place one player from each team as a target player between the goal their team is scoring on.
• The coach should have a supply of balls to the outside of the grid.
instructions_text:
• The coach begins by playing a ball into one of the two teams.
• The team in possession must keep possession and play a ball to the target player before scoring on one of the two goals.
• If the other team wins possession of the ball, they attack the other set of goals by getting the ball to their target player before scoring a goal.
• Target player should play in one-touch. Allow two-touches depending on the skill level of the target player.
• Taget players should remain off the field and can play along the line or behind the line as long as they stay between the two goals.
• Once the ball is out of play or a goal is scored, the coach will play into one of the two players from either team.
• Players not in the game should position themselves behind their defensive goals ready for the next ball in.
• The game is intended to be fast-paced.
variations_text: • Enlarge the field and play a 3v3 or 4v4
coaching_points_text:
• Attempt to play the target player early.
• Once a ball is played into the target player, both players should make runs off the ball to score from a one-touch shot. However, two touches can be used to score a goal.
• Overlapping runs often help unbalance the defenders.
• The target player is allowed to move along the line between the two goals, but should not join in on the 2v2.

name: 1v1 Transition Game
description:
This is a fast-paced 1v1 game that focuses on quickly transitioning from the attack to defense.














1v1 Transition


1v1 Transition Soccer Drill


This is a fast-paced 1v1 game that focuses on quickly transitioning from the attack to defense.
setup_text:
• Create a grid approximately 25x25 yards.
• Instead of lining up the goals in the center of the end line, offset the two goals on either side of the grid.
• Create a starting point across from the two offset goals.
• Split the team into two groups giving each group their own color jersey.
• Each player in line should have a ball.
instructions_text:
• Split the tean into two even groups.
• The first player from one line will set up to attack the goal infront of his line.
• One player from the opposite line will step in to defend the attacker.
• As the attacker shoots on goal, the attacker from the other line attacks the goal infront of that player.
• The player that just shot will immediately transition to defense and attept to stop the new attacker.
• Once the new attacker shoots the next player in the other line then attacks and the play continues.
• Players must quickly transition to defense as soon as the shot is taken on goal.
• The game is meant to be fast pased and everyone working at top speed.
• After attacking the goal and defending, players should return to the same starting point as they began.
coaching_points_text:
• Attackers take on the defender and as soon as they shoot they must quickly transition to defense and quickly tackle and defend the attacker from the other group.
• Transition should be instinctful and not thought out.
• Attackers move quickly into defensive position as soon as ball is lost.

name: One-Touch Passing Combination With a Dribble; Series 2
description:
This is the second series to a fast-paced one-touch passing combination warmup drill with a light dribble at the end.














One-Touch Passing Combination with a Dribble; Series 2


one-touch passing, passing combination, soccer dribbling


This is the second series to a great one-touch passing combination warm up soccer drill with light dribbling.
setup_text:
• With cones or training sticks, create a grid approximately 20x20 yards.
• Place two or three training sticks doen the middle of the grid.
• Place the starting cone about 5 yards from the top of the grid aligned in the middle of the area.
• Start a player at each of the four corners of the grid.
• The remaining players should line up behind the start cone; each with a ball.
instructions_text:
• This is the second series of this one-touch passing combination drill.
• Player 1 passes to player 3.
• Player 3 passes to player 2.
• Player 2 passes to player 3 on the other side of the training stick.
• Player 3 makes a run around the training stick and receives the pass.
• Player 3 receives the pass and dribbles in-and-out of the training sticks set up in the middle of the field.
• Player 3 returns to the back of the line.
• Player 1 takes player 2's starting position.
• Player 2 takes player 3's starting position.
• The combination play coninues on the other side of the grid in the same pattern and movement.
variations_text:
• Play in two-touch passes for beginners.
• Another combination: One-Touch Passing Combination with a Dribble; Series 1
coaching_points_text:
• Passes must be precise and to the feet of the receiving player.
• Good movement off the ball to create space and time the passes.
• Play in one-touch if possible. Slowing the drill to two-touches will allow players to get familiar with the pattern, and pace of the passes.
• If a bad pass is given, adjust accordingly and continue the drill.

name: One-Touch Passing Combination With a Dribble; Series 1
description:
This is the first series to a great one-touch passing combination warmup drill with a light dribble. This is a passing pattern drill that focuses on one-touch passing, receiving, movement off the ball with touches on the ball.














One-Touch Passing Combination with a Dribble; Series 1


This is the first series to a great one-touch passing combination warmup drill with a light dribble.


one-touch, passing combination, passing receiving, light dribble
setup_text:
• With cones or training sticks, create a grid approximately 20x20 yards.
• Place two to three training sticks down the middle of the grid.
• Place a starting cone about 5 yards from the grid in the middle of the grid.
• Start a player at each of the 4 corners of the grid.
• The remaining players will line up behind the start cone; each with a ball.
instructions_text:
• This is the first series of the one-touch passing combination.
• Player 1 passes to player 2.
• Player 2 returns the pass to player 1.
• Player 1 then passes to player 3.
• Player 3 passes to player 2.
• Player 3 runs around the other side of the training stick and player 2 passes to player 3.
• Player 3 receives the pass and dribbles in-and-out of the training sticks set up inthe center of the field.
• Player 3 returns to the back of the line.
• Player 1 takes player 2's starting position.
• Player 2 takes player 3's starting position.
• The play continues on the other side of the grid in the same combination and movement.
variations_text:
• Play in two-touch passes for beginners.
• Follow this drill up with: One-Touch Passing Combination with a Dribble; Series 2
coaching_points_text:
• Passes must be precise and to the feet of the receiving player.
• Good movement off the ball to create space and time the passes.
• Play in one-touch if possible. Slowing the drill to two-touches will allow players to get familiar with the pattern, and pace of the passes.
• If a bad pass is given, adjust accordingly and continue the drill.

name: 1v1 Transition
description:
That is a fast paced 1v1 transition game mean to focus on beating the defender and getting it into your teammate, or quickly transition to defense if the ball is lost.














1v1 Transition Game


1v1, one vs one, soccer game


That is a fast paced 1v1 transition game mean to focus on beating the defender and getting it into your teammate, or quickly transition to defense if the ball is lost.
setup_text:
• Split 6 players into two groups with different color jerseys.
• Create a 15X15 yard grid.
• Using cones, create a 5 yard window on each of the 4 sides of the grid.
• Teammates should line up in the window across from their own team.
• One player from one of the two teams starts as a defender.
instructions_text:
• One team starts with the ball to attack the defender in attempt to get across the grid to their teammate waiting in the window.
• If the attacker successfully passes to their teammate, the new attacker then takes on the same defender and attempts to beat the defender and get to the other side of the grid to the waiting attacker.
• If the defender wins the ball, they play a ball to either of their teammates along the side. The attacker losing the ball becomes defender.
• The play continues as attackers lose the ball they immediately become the defender.
coaching_points_text:
• Attackers move with sped to take on the defenders.
• Attackers make one or two quick feints and fakes before getting the ball to their teammate.
• Attackers as soon as the ball is lost, quickly transition to defense and win the ball back quickly.
• Defenders, good body position on the attacker. Remember fast, slow, get down low, and get your hands on the attacker.
• Defenders remember ball or player, never both.

name: 4v4, Thirds of the Field, Shape and Positioning
description:
This 4v4 drill is great for improving shape and positioning. Each player has their own responsibility: 1) attacker/target player stretches the field closer to the goal they are attacking. 2) winger players stretch the width of the field. 3) defensive player gives support to wingers and target player while staying the last man.














4v4, Thirds of the Field, Shape and Positioning 


4v4, thirds of the field, improve shape and positioning


This 4v4 thirds of the field drill is great for improving shape and positioning.
setup_text:
• To set up this 4v4 soccer drill, create a grid that is approximately 40 X 25 yards.
• With small disc cones, divide the field into thirds; left, center, right
• Set a Pugg goal at each endline.
• Divide the group into two teams of four players each.
• Restrict the left wingers in the left third of the field, the right wingers in the right third of the field, and the target player and defender to the center third of the field.
instructions_text:
• Play 4v4 with each team defending a Pugg goal and scoring on the opponents Pugg goal.
• Players are restricted to their third of the field and are encouraged to move up and down their third in order to support their teammates.
• When a team reaches 5 goals switch out players or teams.
variations_text: • Allow players to switch into other thirds of the pitch, but when this happens, they must switch with the player occupying the grid they are moving into.
coaching_points_text:
• Offensively:
• Vision - players should be able to look up and read the game with their eyes since their number is limited. Player's heads should be on a constant pivot.
• Communication - make sure players are communicating both verbally and non-verbally.
• Support - make sure players are using their third of the field to get into the right supporting angles. Create passing options that allow the receiving players the most time and space.
• Appropriate use of 1st touch
• Appropriate use of short or long passing
• Changes in the direction and speed of play
• Create goal scoring opportunities
• Defensively:
• Sound Defensive Principles - pressure, cover, balance
• Get as many people behind the ball as possible
• Good communication

name: 1v1 Speed and Reaction Game
description:
This 1v1 Speed and Reaction Game is a fun addition to any practice that focuses on quick reaction and speed, ending with a 1v1 to small goals.














1v1 Speed and Reaction Game


1v1 Speed and Reaction Game


1v1 Speed and Reaction Game is a fun addition to any practice that focuses on quick reaction and speed, ending with a 1v1 to small goals.
setup_text:
• Create a grid about 15x25 yards. Adjust the size of the grid based on the age, size, and skillset of your team.
• Set small goals on each end of the field.
• Split the team into two groups. Each group starts on the same sideline as the coach.
• The coach should have a supply of soccer balls.
• Create a gate with cones or flags in the center of the opposite sideline.
• With colored cones, or pinnies, clearly define one side as blue, and the other as yellow.
instructions_text:
• On the coaches command players sprint around the color called, then sprint through the gate on the opposite side of the field.
• The coach tosses a ball into the center of the field where either player can attack either goal.
• Once a goal is scored, or the ball goes out of bounds, a player from each team steps up and the coach calls another color.
variations_text:
• Decrease the size of the field to work on closer sprints and footwork.
• Increase the size fo the field to work on longer sprints and more space on the field.
coaching_points_text:
• Quick reaction from players.
• Sprint around and through the gate.
• Battle for the ball and score as quickly as possible.

name: 2v2 with Target Players to Small Goals
description:
This 2v2 drill focuses on penetrating passes to a target player to stretch the field and finish on goal.














2v2 with Target Players to Small Goals


2v2 with Target Players


2v2 drill focusing on penetrating passes to a target player to stretch the field and finish on goal.
setup_text:
• Create a 25x40 yard grid.
• Split six players into two groups of 3.
• Place a target for each team on the end line of the goal they are attacking.
• The remaining players will play 2v2.
instructions_text:
• Players play 2v2 in the area.
• To score, players must play into their target player, and receive the ball from the target player to be unlocked to score.
• The target player can move along the goal line.
variations_text:
• Switch out the target players.
• Create multiple playing fields so that all players engaged.
coaching_points_text:
• Encourage players to play forward to push the ball down the field.
• Target players must be prepared to play in one or two touches.
• Attackers must move to position themselves in a good supporting position to receive a ball from the target player and score.

name: 1v1 Attacking to a Full-Size Goal
description:
This 1v1 attacking drill that focuses on beating the defender in a 1v1 situation and finishing on a full-size goal.














1v1 Attacking to a Full-Size Goal


1v1 to a full-size goal


1v1 attacking drill that focuses on beating the defender in a 1v1 situation and finishing on a full-size goal.
setup_text:
• Set two full-size goals about 25 yards from each other with a goalkeeper in each goal.
• Split the team into two groups starting at each of the two goals.
• Both teams will need a supply of balls near.
• Designate one team as the defensive team. These players start with the ball.
• The other team is the attackers. They do not need at ball at this time.
instructions_text:
• The defensive player plays a long ball into the first attacker and quickly closes down the attacker.
• The attacking player receives the ball and quickly takes on the defender.
• Once the defender is beat, the attacking player finishes on goal.
• If the defensive player wins the ball cleanly the play is over and on to the next attacker.
• After each attacker has had an opportunity to play the two groups switch roles.
variations_text: • Each team attacks with each player, then the two groups switch roles.
coaching_points_text:
• Good controlling touch
• Quality approach with the right amount of speed and control
• Make sure the attacker dribbles directly at the defender.
• Have the player "fake" by stepping over the ball, having a hard step, stutter-step, dragging a foot or toe, dipping their shoulders, faking a kick, or using their eyes to look in a direction opposite of where they are going.
• Good change of direction once a fake is made to move away from the defender.
• Good change-of-pace to leave the defender once they have them off-balanced from the fake and change of direction.

name: 1v1 Three Grid Gauntlet Attacking Drill
description:
The 1v1 three grid attacking drill focuses on dribbling to beat multiple defenders.














1v1 Three Grid Gauntlet Attacking Drill


1v1 Attacking Drill


1v1 Attacking Gauntlet Drill focuses on dribbling to beat defenders.
setup_text:
• Create a gauntlet with three adjacent grids that are 10x10 yards each.
• Split the team into two groups. One group attackers, the other are defenders.
• Attackers will start at one end line about 7 yards from the grid.
• Start with a defender in each grid and the remaining defenders at the opposite end of the attackers about 7 yards from the grid.
• The coach should be on the end with the attackers with a large supply of soccer balls.
instructions_text:
• The coach passes into the first attacker.
• The attacker attempts to dribble through grid 1, grid 2, and then grid 3.
• If the defender wins the ball in either of the grids, or the ball is played out of the area, the attacker returns to the attacker line.
• The defenders all move up one grid closer to the attacker. The defender in grid 1 returns to the defender's line.
variations_text:
• Have the defenders play at 50% if the attackers are struggling. After they are more comfortable, increase the defensive pressure.
• Make sure both teams attack and defend.
coaching_points_text:
• Get the ball under control quickly.
• Attack with speed.
• Attack the defenders front foot.
• Attempting to attack the space behind the defender.
• Use fakes and feints to off balance the defender.
• Quick change of pace and change of direction. Speed is critical.
• Make sure the player is in control of the ball and not just kicking the ball forward.

name: Passing Warm-up Drill
description:
This passing and overlapping warm-up soccer drill will help perfect the introduction of overlapping runs, playing off the pass, as well as teamwork through communication.














Line Passing Overlap Warm-up


 Passing and overlaping soccer drill


This passing and overlapping warm-up soccer drill will help perfect the introduction of overlapping runs.
setup_text:
• Start with 4 cones set along a sideline about 10 yards apart.
• Line the players evenly up behind each of the cones.
• The players on each of the outside cones start with the ball.
instructions_text:
• Player 1 passes to player 2 at the same time player 4 passes to player 3.
• Player 2 and 3 dribbles with speed to the outside line.
• Player 1 makes an overlapping run around player 2 and runs into the space player 3 is leaving.
• Player 4 overlaps player 3 and fills the space that player 2 is leaving.
• Continue this pattern until the players reach the other side of the field.
• Encourage players to keep the same spacing as they started.
variations_text: • Be creative and add other activities to mix things up.
coaching_points_text:
• Quality of passes into the feet or space of the attacker.
• Make early runs with speed since they have a long way to travel.
• Dribbling players should angle the dribble towards the outside and should dribble with speed.

name: Defensive Clearances- Up and Out
description:
This defensive soccer drill focuses on clearing balls from the defensive third of the field. Defenders are taught to handle difficult balls and clearing them high and wide.














Defensive Clearances- Up and Out


Soccer Defensive Clearances


This defensive soccer drill focuses on clearing balls from the back third of the field. Defenders are taught to handle difficult balls while clearing them high and wide.
setup_text:
• Using half of a full-size field, place one defender on the goal line of their goal.
• Scatter 4 servers around the sidelines, each with a supply of balls.
• Place a few players wide and high on the field to act as a target player for the defender.
instructions_text:
• The defender starts on their defensive goal line.
• Each of the servers will take turns serving a flighted or low driven ball into the penalty area.
• The defender must quickly move off the goal line to clear the ball to one of their targets.
• The defender must make sure each ball clears the penalty area before hitting the ground.
• After the ball clears the penalty area the defender then sprints back to the goal line ready for the next service.
• Have each defender take 8-10 serves before rotating.
variations_text:
• Add a target player inside the penalty area to make the defensive posture more realistic.
• Place 2 defenders and 1 attacker in the penalty area to help communication among multiple players.
coaching_points_text:
• The defender is looking to clear the balls high and to the outside of the field.
• For older players, use the head for clearance when necessary.
• Do not let the ball linger in the penalty area. The defender must react quickly and predict the flight of the ball.
• First touch clearances are a must. However, if players mishandle the first touch, make sure a second effort is taken to clear the ball.
• Players must be comfortable in front of their own goal.

name: 4v1 Rondo
description:
This rondo variation is geared for younger player or players you are just introducing to the rondo training.














4v1 Rondo


4v1 Rondo


This rondo variation is geared for younger player or players you are just introducing to the rondo training.
setup_text:
• Create a 10x10 grid.
• You will need 5 players per grid. You can place many grids around the field as necessary.
• Four offensive players, one on each of the four sidelines positioned outside the area. These players remain on this side of the area and should only travel from left to right along the outside of the area.
• One defensive player starts inside the area. This player is restricted to defending inside this area and should not move outside the area.
• You will start with one ball, but make sure you have a supply of balls close.
instructions_text:
• The offensive team starts with the ball.
• The first pass to another offensive player is free. After this pass, the defensive player attempts to win the ball.
• The offensive players should use their space to quickly pass around the one defender.
• If the defensive player wins the ball or the ball is grossly misplayed, the player making the mistake switches roles with the defender.
variations_text:
• For beginners, have the players play with their hands, although do not allow them to throw the ball higher than their heads. This will force players to open up to the side and get players comfortable with the supporting movements.
• Add a fake before the pass.
• Limit touches: 1-touch or 2-touch only. Rotate defenders if the touch limit is exceeded.
coaching_points_text:
• Offensive players should be moving into good supporting angles to assist their teammates.
• Quality passes and good first touch is a must.
• Encourage players to use body feints and fakes to off-balance a close defender.

name: Rondo Soccer Drill
description:
This rondo soccer drill is the rondo at its simplest. This rondo game is great as a warm-up drill to a game, or a drill for your practice session.














Rondo Soccer Drill


Rondo Soccer Drill


This rondo soccer drill is the rondo at its simplest. This rondo game is great as a warm-up drill to a game, or a drill for your practice session.
setup_text:
• Create a 12x12 grid.
• Position two defenders inside the grid.
• Position the remaining players evenly spaced out around the outside of the grid.
instructions_text:
• The players outside the grid start with a pass to any of the players on the outside of the grid.
• The outside players attempt to remain in possession without letting the defenders win the ball.
• The defensive players try to cut off passing lanes and win possession of the ball.
• If possession is lost, whether to a defensive player, a bad pass, or a bad touch, the player making the mistake switches roles with one of the defenders.
• Players should switch fast, and the game should not stop for long.
variations_text:
• Limit the defensive side to 1 player for a lower skill level.
• Shrink the playing area for more skilled players.
• Limit touches to 1-touch.
coaching_points_text:
• Players should only move minimally, left and right, to position themselves in good passing lanes.
• Encourage players to be creative as players often have to rely on tricks, flicks, flighted-balls, back-heels, and 1-touch passing
• Receiving players must learn how to react to handle all types of balls played to them.
• Players should think ahead of the play and be ready to play immediately.

name: Soccer Shooting on the Dribble
description:
This soccer shooting exercise will focus on shooting on the turn. Players will need to turn quickly towards the goal to get a shot on goal.














Shooting on the Turn


shooting on the turn, turn shot, quick turn and shot


Soccer shooting drill focusing on shooting on the turn. Players will need to turn quickly towards the goal to get a shot on goal.
setup_text:
• You will need a full-size goal with a keeper in the goal.
• Set up two cones about 20 yards from goal about 10 yards apart.
• Split the team into two groups starting at each corner flag.
• Each player needs a ball.
instructions_text:
• The first player from group 1 dribbles toward the cone on his side.
• As he gets about 5 yards from the cone, he should pass the ball to the inside of the cone and run around the outside of the cone.
• Without taking another touch, the player then has a shot on goal.
• The 1st player in group 2 starts as soon as the shot is taken.
variations_text:
• Have a competition and keep score of goals made.
• Switch sides, so players shoot with both feet.
• Change the distance of the shot by moving the cone close or farther back.
coaching_points_text:
• The shooter should get their hips squared up with the goal quickly.
• Shoot with the correct foot. If starting in the line on the right side of the goal, shoot with your left foot. If starting in the line on the left side of the goal, shoot with your right foot.
• Good shooting form.
• Good prep touch pass around the cone.
• Follow the shot.
• Good keeper positioning.

name: Two-Goal Soccer Shooting Training Session
description:
This soccer shooting training session focuses on receiving a ground pass and shooting followed up with receiving a long ball and shooting on target.














Two-Goal Soccer Shooting Training Session


Soccer Shooting Training Session


This soccer shooting training session focuses on receiving a ground pass and shooting followed up with receiving a long ball and shooting on target.
setup_text:
• Set a full-size portable goal approximately 35-40 yards from the primary goal.
• Assign a keeper in each of the goals.
• Create 4 8x8 grids in a square pattern as shown in the diagram.
• Assign two servers on the left side of the goals with a collection of soccer balls.
• Split the remaining players into two lines that start along the sidelines.
• See the diagram for field setup and layout.
instructions_text:
• The first player in line 1 sprints into grid 2 towards grid 1.
• Server 2 plays a ball into grid 1 as the player approaches they should have a touch (if needed) and shoot on goal 1.
• After the shot, the player sprints through the end of grid 1 and sprints towards the center of the area.
• Server 1 plays a ball into the approaching runner and the shooter has a shot on goal 2.
• After the shot, the first player in line 2 sprints into grid 4 and into grid 3.
• Server 2 plays a ball into grid 3 as the player approaches.
• This player shoots on goal 2, and sprints to the end of grid 3, and moves to the center of the area.
• Server 2 plays a ball into the approaching runner and the shooter takes a shot on goal 1.
variations_text:
• Switch the side of the goals the servers start.
• Switch servers after 10 or so serves.
coaching_points_text:
• Good movement off of the ball.
• Body position squared up to the goal and ready for the shot.
• A good shot on goal.
• Goals, goals, and more goals.

name: Combination Play Through the Central Midfielders
description:
This soccer passing and combination drill focus on passing combination play through the central midfielder players.














Combination Play Through the Central Midfielders


Combination Play Through the Central Midfielders


This soccer passing and combination drill focus on passing combination play through the central midfielder players.
setup_text:
• Create a 30x20 yard grid.
• Place a player on each of the four corners of the grid.
• Along each sideline, place two central players.
• A corner player will start with the ball.
instructions_text:
• Player 1 starts with the ball and plays into the farthest of the two midfield players.
• The farthest midfield player then plays to the other midfielder near him, who then plays the ball to the corner player (Player 2).
• Player 2 then plays the ball into Player 1 who is approaching Player 2's corner.
• Player 1 plays across the grid to Player 3.
• Player 3 returns the ball to the approaching player Player 2.
• Player 2 plays into the midfielder farthest from the ball and the play repeats around the grid.
variations_text:
• Play in 1-touch only.
• Reverse the direction of play.
coaching_points_text:
• Crisp passes to feet.
• Good pace on the passes.
• Players time runs.
• Accuracy of passes.

name: Finishing in Front of the Goal
Combination - Pass and Move
description:
This passing and moving combination soccer drill focuses on crisp, clean passing, timing, movement off the ball, and the speed of play.














Combination - Pass and Move


Soccer Combination Play, Pass and Move


This passing and moving combination soccer drill focuses on crisp, clean passing, timing, movement off the ball, and the speed of play.
setup_text:
• Place a cone at the four corners of a grid approximately 30x20 yards. Adjust the size of the grid based on age, skill, and length of combination play.
• Place a cone on the about 10 yards from two diagonal corners as shown in the diagram.
• Stagger a cone about 7 yards from the cone on the side on each corner as shown in the diagram.
• Have a player at each cone with the balls starting in the two corners.
instructions_text:
• Player 1 passes to Player 2 and moves to Player 2's cone.
• Player 2 passes to Player 3.
• Player 3 passes back to Player 2.
• Player 3 passes to Player 4.
• Player 2 moves to Player 3's cone.
• Player 3 moves to Player 4's cone.
• Player 4 dribbles with speed to the other Player 1's cone.
• The drill repeats.
variations_text:
• Switch directions of the play to work on different angles and passes.
• Same as above, except play a long ball to player 1 instead of dribbling to them.
coaching_points_text:
• Focus on crisp, clean passes.
• Movement off the ball must be timed with the pass.
• The drill should flow with a continuous passing pattern.
• Focus on speeding up the combination play.

name: 1v1 Battle - Attacking and Reaction Drill
description:
This 1v1 soccer battle drill will focus on the attacker's change of direction, change of pace, and burst of speed to the goal all while working on the defender's ability to close down the attacker quickly, reaction time, speed of recovery, and angles of defense.














1v1 Battle - Attacking and Reaction Drill


1v1 Soccer Battle; Attacking and Reaction Drill


This 1v1 soccer battle drill will focus on the attacking and defending aspects of the game.
setup_text:
• Create a grid 40 yards wide and 30 yards long. (wider than longer)
• Place a small goal or Pugg Goal on each end line.
• Split the team into two groups.
• Place one group on the sideline without the ball; they will be the attacker.
• Place the other group on the opposite sideline with a ball; they will be the defender.
instructions_text:
• The first defender steps out with a ball.
• They pass the ball to the first attacker in the line and quickly moves to close down the attack.
• The attacker can attack either of the two small goals.
• The defender, not knowing which goal he will attack must react quickly to the attacker's movements to close down the attack.
• The attacker can fake and feint and go in either direction at any time during this drill.
• Once the goal is scored or the ball goes out of bounds, the play is over and the next two players begin.
• The drill repeats with the next defender and attacker.
• Have the player's switch lines so they have the opportunity to attack and defend.
coaching_points_text:
• Encourage the attacker to use feints, fakes, change of direction, and speed to confuse off-balance the defender.
• Encourage the defender to watch the attacker's hips rather than the ball, close the attacker down quickly, and react quickly.

name: 2v2 Battle - Attacking and Defending Drill
description:
This 2v2 soccer attacking and defending drill focuses on the attacker's decision to dribble, pass, or shoot. From the defensive side, they must quickly close down the attackers and deny space.














2v2 Battle - Attacking and Defending Drill


2v2 Soccer Battle, Soccer Attacking, Soccer Defending


This 2v2 soccer attacking and defending drill focuses on the attacker's decision to dribble, pass, or shoot. From the defensive side, they must quickly close down the attackers and deny space.
setup_text:
• Create a 40X30 grid. The grid should be wider than longer.
• Place a small goal or Pugg Goal on each end line.
• Split the team into two groups.
• Have one group start on the sideline without a ball; they will be the attackers.
• The other group will start on the opposite sideline with a ball; they are the defenders.
instructions_text:
• Two defenders step out with one ball.
• Two attackers also step out without a ball.
• The defender with the ball passes to one of the attackers.
• The defenders quickly move to close down the two attackers.
• The attackers must immediately start with a pass to the second attacker. Encourage deception such as overlapping runs from the attackers to throw off the approaching defenders.
• The attackers can attack either of the two goals.
• Once a goal is scored, the ball goes out of bounds, or the defensive team wins the ball, the play is over and the next group begins.
• The drill repeats with two new defenders and two new attackers.
• Switch the roles of each line to allow the opportunity to attack and defend.
variations_text:
• Modify the field size to play 3v3.
• Limit the touches of the attackers to encourage more passing and 1-2's.
coaching_points_text:
• Attackers
• Encourage attackers to work together to quickly and effectively attack the goal and score quickly.
• Continuous movement to assist your teammate.
• Make the right decision to either dribble to beat a defender, pass, or shoot.
• Defenders
• Quickly close down the attackers to deny space.
• Continue working hard until the ball is won.
• Proper body mechanics while defending to hold off the attackers.

name: The Cristiano Ronaldo Speed Test
description:
The Cristiano Ronaldo Speed Test is an individual assessment of ones ability to dribble the ball at pace while maintaining control.














The Cristiano Ronaldo Speed Test


Cristiano Ronaldo Speed Test


The Cristiano Ronaldo Speed Test is an individual assessment of ones ability to dribble the ball at pace while maintaining control.
setup_text:
• Create a 4x4 yard grid 6 yards from the goal line. This grid will be your starting point.
• Create a gate about 6 yards from the goal box directly in line with your starting grid.
• Create a 4-yard gate on each of the top corners of the goal box approximately 3 yards from the corner.
• The player will start in the starting grid without a ball.
• The ball will be placed in the gate directly above the goalbox.
• The coach needs a stopwatch to record the time it takes for players to complete this activity.
instructions_text:
• One player will start at the starting point without a ball.
• This player will sprint to the grid containing the ball and dribbles through the gate.
• He then dribbles to the gate on one of the corners of the grid, does a figure-8 through the gate, and sprints to the gate on the opposite corner of the goal box.
• The dribbler performs a figure-8 through this gate and moves back through the gate at the top of the goal box.
• The dribbler then dribbles the ball back into the starting grid where he has a shot on goal within the 4x4 starting grid.
• The stopwatch stops when the ball hits the back of the net.
coaching_points_text:
• Dribbling with speed.
• Quick tight turns around the cones when doing the figure-8's.
• Ball close when dribbling tight corners, push out a bit when dribbling across the face of the penalty area.
• Precise shot on goal aiming for the corners of the goal.

name: 4v2 Soccer Game to Goal
description:
This drill develops players' ability to attack and defend in small spaces while encouraging quick decision-making, teamwork, and fitness through constant movement.














3v3 to Goals


3v3 soccer, small-sided game, attacking, defending, transition play


A small-sided 3v3 game that enhances attacking, defending, and transition play while providing high-energy, game-like scenarios with continuous player rotation.
setup_text:
• Field Size: 20x30 yards
• Goals: Two goals, one at each end line (cones, training sticks, or small goals)
• Players: Two teams (yellow & blue), rotating substitutes
• Ball Supply: Multiple soccer balls with the coach
• Starting Positions: 3 players per team on the field, substitutes waiting near the coach
instructions_text:
• Divide players into two teams (yellow and blue) and assign each team a goal to defend.
• Play begins with a kickoff or coach's pass-in.
• Teams compete 3v3, working to score while defending their goal.
• After 1-2 minutes, rotate one player from each team off and a new player on to keep legs fresh.
• If there are 12 or more players, run a second 3v3 game, rotating teams every 3-4 minutes.
• Play continues with quick rotations, ensuring all players get equal playtime.
variations_text:
• Touch Restriction: Limit players to two touches to encourage faster play.
• Weaker Foot Challenge: Players must shoot using their weaker foot.
• Man-Marking Challenge: Each player must mark a specific opponent at all times.
• Bonus Points: Award an extra point for a goal scored after three consecutive passes.
• Different Scoring Zones: Require players to shoot from inside a designated area for a goal to count.
coaching_points_text:
• This fast-paced drill simulates real-game situations, enhances player development in both attack and defense, and keeps players engaged with constant movement and rotations.
• Encourage Quick Decision-Making: Players must react fast in attacking and defensive situations.
• Support & Movement Off the Ball: Players should create passing options and space.
• Defensive Organization: Defenders must communicate and work as a unit.
• Transition Play: Quickly transition from defense to attack and vice versa.
• Finishing Under Pressure: Players should take quick, accurate shots when opportunities arise.

name: One-Touch Diamond Passing Combination
description:
The One-Touch Diamond Passing Combination drill focuses on a number of quick one-touch combination passes and movement off the ball.














One-Touch Diamond Passing Combination


Soccer Passing Combination, One-Touch Passing Combinations


This passing combination drill focuses on a number of quick one-touch combination passes and movement off the ball.
setup_text:
• Create a large diamond approximately 12 yards between each side of the diamond.
• Place two cones near the middle of the diamond.
• Place a player at each of the 6 cones.
• Two players at opposite points of the diamond will start with the ball.
• The two players in the middle face the player with the ball.
instructions_text:
• The players on either end of the diamond start the drill by playing the ball to the inside player and move to the other side of their cone to receive a pass back from the center player.
• After they receive the pass back from the center player they play to the player to their right.
• This player then passes to the center player, moves to the other side of the cone, receives the ball, and plays to the player to their right.
• This pattern will continue around the grid.
• When playing with two balls, make sure each player is aware of the 2nd ball at all times.
• The central players work only with the two points of the diamond and do not switch at this point in the drill.
variations_text:
• Have the central players follow their ball around the grid
• Limit touches to 1-touch only.
coaching_points_text:
• Good weight on the pass
• Good pace of the pass
• Good Angle of the pass
• Time runs before and after the pass
• Good One-two's
• Keep the movement fluid and the body under control
