• The remaining two players from each team defend their assigned end line.
• The end line players can move from side to side along the end line; however, they cannot enter the grid.
• To score, the team in possession must make a pass no higher than knee-high past the opponents defending the end line.
• Each time a team scores, the end line defenders rotate with attackers.
variations_text:
• Increase grid size and play 3v3 with 3 end line players.
• Require a certain number of passes before attacking the end line.
• Allow the defensive end line players to be passed to in order to maintain possession.
coaching_points_text:
• Make sure players are actually passing the ball rather than just kicking.
• Passes must have a good pace and play to space.
• Players must move to help the passing player keep possession.
• Make sure players are playing balls away from the end line defenders.

name: Check-In Passing Warm-Up
description:
This passing and receiving warm-up drill is a great soccer drill to help with timing and striking a ball while checking in to a pass.














Check-in Passing Warm-up


Passing Drill while Checking-in


This passing warm-up drill is a great soccer drill to help with timing and striking a ball while checking in to a pass.
setup_text:
• Create three lines of cones spaced 5 yards apart. Make sure the cones line up between the three lines.
• Divide your team into groups of two, with one ball per group.
• Players will start on each of the outside lines.
• One player is working, and one player is playing into the working player.
instructions_text:
• Both players start on the outside line.
• The non-working player passes the ball into the working player.
• The working player checks-in towards the middle cone, receives the ball just outside the middle cone, and plays the ball back into the non-working player.
• The working player then backpedals to the outside line where they began and repeats this ten times before switching partners.
• Change how the player receives the touch:
• Inside of the foot: Have the player receive the ball with inside of foot across the body and pass with the inside of the opposite foot.
• Outside of the foot: Have the receiving touch with the outside of the foot to the outside of the same foot and return the pass with the inside of the foot.
• Play in 1-touch with the inside of the foot alternating right and left foot.
• Play in 1-touch with the outside of the foot alternating right and left foot.
variations_text:
• Add other patterns to receive the ball such as the inside of the foot to the outside of the same foot, trap with the outside of the foot and return it with the inside of the same foot, etc.
• Have players pick up the ball and work on taking touches out of the air.
coaching_points_text:
• Receive the ball with the proper surface of the foot.
• When receiving the ball with the inside of the foot, the toe should be slightly lifted with the heel down.
• When receiving the ball with the outside of the foot, make sure the tow is turned inwards towards the plant foot.

name: Diagonal Soccer Shooting Drill
description:
This simple soccer shooting drill is great for warm-up to a shooting practice or warm-up before a game.














Diagonal Soccer Shooting Drill	


diagonal soccer shooting drill, soccer shooting


Simple soccer shooting drill great for warm-up to a shooting practice or warm-up before a game.
setup_text:
• Create a 10X10 grid just beyond on the edge of the penalty area.
• Divide the team into two lines on the far cones.
• One player from each line steps up to the cone near the edge penalty area. This player becomes the player that lays the ball off to the shooter at the cone.
instructions_text:
• Player 1 starts by passing a diagonal ball to player 4.
• Player 4 lays the ball off into space for player 1 to run onto and strike a one-touch shot on goal.
• The shooting player (player 1) takes the place of player 4.
• Player 4 collects the ball from the goal or shags any missed shots and gets back into line with a ball.
• Next, Player 2 passes a diagonal ball to player 3.
• Player 3 lays the ball off to player 2, who has a one-touch shot on goal.
• Player 2 becomes the target player.
• Player (player 3) collects the ball from the goal or shags any missed shots and gets back into line with a ball.
• Make sure the players switch lines, so they shoot with both feet.
variations_text:
• Have the target player flick a ball into the air for the shooting player to volley or half-volley.
• For less-skilled players, have them pick up the balls and toss them in the air for the shooting player to volley or half-volley.
coaching_points_text:
• Good controlled approach on the ball
• Plant foot in a good spot next to the ball
• Shoot with the appropriate foot
• Hit the ball on target

name: Cross - Finish Under Pressure
description:
This crossing and finishing drill is excellent for focusing on crossing and finishing under pressure. It is also a great drill to improve the player's fitness level.














Cross - Finish Under Pressure


Cross and Finish, Crossing Under Pressure, Finishing Under Pressure


Crossing and finishing drill focusing on crossing and finishing under pressure. It is also a great drill to improve the player's fitness level.
setup_text:
• This drill will require the attacking third of the field with a full-size goal and a goalkeeper.
• Split the team up evenly among each of the four cones positioned near midfield, as seen in the diagram.
• There should be a large supply of balls at the cone of player 1.
instructions_text:
• Player 1 plays a firm ball into the corner of the field for player 3 to run onto.
• As player 3 leaves his cone, player 4 also leaves his cone to pressure player 3. Player 4 is looking to deny the cross.
• Player 2 also leaves to defend player 1 on the cross.
• Player 3 crosses the ball into player 1, who attempts to finish on goal.
• Rotate players so that they play both offense and defense on all of the spots.
coaching_points_text:
• Attackers:
• Play a firm ball to get the ball deep in the area near the end line.
• Crosser has a quick but quality prep touch and crosses from the outside.
• Runners must time their runs and anticipate the flight of the cross. You don't want the runners in too quickly and standing. If they get there too soon, have them rotate out and back into the service area.
• Defenders:
• Sprint to close down the crosser quickly while getting to the inside position.
• Track runners and get inside position.
• Clear balls up and outside.

name: Shooting on the Turn
description:
This soccer shooting drill focuses on receiving a flighted ball, quickly dribble on the attack, and finishing with a shot on goal.














Soccer Shooting on the Dribble


Soccer Shooting on the Dribble


Soccer shooting drill focusing on receiving a flighted ball, quickly dribble on the attack, and finishing with a shot on goal.
setup_text:
• Set a full-size portable goal approximately 35-40 yards from the primary goal.
• Assign a keeper in each of the goals.
• Create four 8x8 grids in a square pattern as shown in the diagram.
• Assign two servers on the left side of the goals with a collection of soccer balls.
• Split the remaining players into two lines that start along the sidelines.
• See the diagram for field setup and layout.
instructions_text:
• The first player of Line 1 sprints into grid 1 and turns and sprints into grid 2.
• Server 1 plays a flighted ball into this runner as he's about to enter grid 2.
• As this player receives the flighted ball, they turn dribble towards goal 1 and has a shot on goal.
• As soon as this player takes his shot, the first player in line 2 begins.
• The first player at line 2 sprints into grid 3, cuts and sprints towards grid 4.
• Server 2 plays a ball into this player.
• This player receives the flighted ball, turns, dribbles towards goal 2, and finishes with a shot on goal.
• Repeat this same progression.
variations_text:
• Switch the side of the goals the servers start.
• Switch servers after 10 or so serves.
coaching_points_text:
• As players enter into the first grid, have players do a head fake and change of speed and pace before entering the 2nd grid.
• Receiving players should have a good close touch, quick turn, and get on the dribble quickly.
• Dribble with speed as heading to the goal.
• Shoot in stride as dribbling to the goal.

name: Soccer Fitness; Improving Reaction and Acceleration
description:
This soccer fitness exercise focuses on improving player's reaction time and acceleration.














Soccer Fitness; Improving Reaction and Acceleration


soccer fitness, improving reaction, improve acceleration, reaction and acceleration


Soccer fitness drill focusing on improving player's reaction time and acceleration.
setup_text:
• Create a grid that is 30 X 30 yards.
• Place a cone directly in the middle of the grid.
• Split the teams up evenly on the four corners.
• No balls are required at the beginning but will be used later in this drill.
instructions_text:
• Players 1 and 2 are the lead players, players 3 and 4 are the followers.
• Instruct players to return to their same line after each turn.
• Players 1 and 4 jogs towards the middle cone.
• Player 1 makes a fake (or two) and sprints to either cone 2 or 3.
• The goal is for the lead player (player 1) to make it to the cone before the following player (player 4).
• If player 4 beats player 1 to the cone, player 1 does five pushups.
• Switch the leaders and followers after a few rounds.
variations_text:
• Switch so that all players have a chance to lead and follow.
• Add balls and make players dribble, make a fake and beat the follower to the cone.
coaching_points_text:
• The leaders should use body fakes and faints then quickly sprints to the cone
• The followers should react quickly and accelerates to beat the leader

name: Team Tactics Dribbling in the Attacking Third
description:
This soccer attacking drill is a great team tactic dribbling drill that focuses on when and where to dribble in the attacking third.














Team Tactics Dribbling in the Attacking Third


dribbling in the attacking third, dribbling tactics, soccer dribbling tactics


This soccer attacking drill is a great team tactic dribbling drill that focuses on when and where to dribble in the attacking third.
setup_text:
• This drill requires the attacking third of the field with a full-size goal.
• Split the team into six attackers, six defenders, a goalkeeper, and a server.
• The server will start around midfield with a supply of balls.
• Assign each defender an attacker. These defenders are restricted to defending this attacker only and should play tight man-to-man defense.
instructions_text:
• Attackers move to get free from their defender to receive a pass from the server.
• As the attacker receives the ball, they must immediately face his defender before dribbling.
• The attacker's decision at this point is to:
• (1) take a shot if an opportunity exists;
• (2) make a pass to a player in a more advantageous spot;
• (3) dribble to beat the defender.
• If the defensive team wins the ball, the play is dead, and the server quickly starts with a new ball.
variations_text: • Remove restrictions on the defenders.
coaching_points_text:
• The tight defense will create a risk in going forward, but a risk that must be taken to score.
• Players work together to create space.
• Decisions:
• Dribble
• Players must dribble in the offensive third when a pass or shot is not available. Look to beat the defender and get to the space behind the defense.
• Pass
• when a shot is not available in the attacking 3rd, a player must pass. It's critical that supporting players always create space from their defenders and support the player with the ball.
• Shoot
• A player misses all shots that they do not take. Encourage players to beat the defender and get a shot on goal. A half-chance is a better option than no shot.

name: Teaching 1st Defender Without Opposition
description:
This soccer defending drill is excellent for teaching young players how to defend when they are the closest player to the opponent with the ball.














Teaching 1st Defender without Opposition


Soccer Defending, Soccer Teaching 1st Defender, First Defender Soccer, Teaching First Defender


This soccer defending drill is excellent for teaching young players how to defend when they are the closest player to the opponent with the ball.
setup_text:
• You will need the attacking third of a field with a full-size goal. The goal is necessary to focus on the defensive player's positioning between the ball and the goal.
• Split the team into two groups of defenders who start on both sides of the goal.
• Two attacking players are positioned outside the penalty area on both sides of the field, with a ball.
instructions_text:
• On the coach's command, the first defender from each line closes down the attacker.
• The defenders should focus on a fast, controlled approach while positioning their body between the ball and the middle of the goal.
• At this point, the defenders are not trying to win the ball but working on the speed of the approach, body posture, and positioning.
• Let every player go 4-5 times or until they are comfortable with approaching the attacker.
variations_text: • Have the defenders start with the ball, pass to the attacker, and focus on the same items above.
coaching_points_text:
• Fast, Controlled approach to close down space quickly.
• Good body posture with bent knees, slightly leaning forward with the weight on the balls of the feet, hips slightly turned so that the defender is not flat, hands up, and eyes on the ball.
• Make sure the defender's body positioning is between the goal and the ball.

name: Winger Taking on Outside Fullback
description:
This dribbling game focuses on the winger players taking on the outside fullbacks in the offensive third of the field.














Winger Taking on Outside Fullback


attacking winger, winger taking on outside fullback, dribbling beat defenders


This dribbling game focuses on the winger players taking on the outside fullbacks in the offensive third of the field.
setup_text:
• This drill requires the attacking third of the field with a full-size goal.
• Split the team into six attackers, six defenders, a goalkeeper, and a server.
• The server will start around midfield with a supply of balls.
• Mark off a lane from each sideline that is 15 yards wide.
• Place a left-winger in the left lane and a right-winger in the right lane.
• Place one defender in each of the two lanes, so the wingers play a 1v1 on each side.
• The remaining players (4v4) start between the two lanes.
instructions_text:
• The one outside fullbacks and one winger are the only players that are allowed in the lane.
• The server plays the ball into one of the two outside wingers to begin the game.
• Instruct the outside fullback to let the winger turn and face him before applying pressure to the winger. If the winger is having problems beating the defender, have the defender play 50-75%.
• The winger will then play 1v1 against the outside back.
• The winger's job is to beat the fullback down the line.
• Only after the winger beats the defender can he pass into the 4v4 in the middle of the field. This service can come off of a pass, cross.
• Once receiving a pass from the winger, the offensive team attempts to score a goal.
• If the defensive team wins the ball, the play is reset and started over from the server at mid-field.
variations_text:
• Only allow a cross from the winger after they beat the defender and focus on crossing and finishing.
• Limit the defensive pressure on the outsides from 50%-75% to allow the winger to get down the line.
coaching_points_text:
• The primary focus is to take on the outside fullback.
• Get wingers comfortable turning towards the goal and attack the space behind the defender.
• Wingers should attack the defender with speed.
• Wingers need to know what to do with the ball after they have beaten the defender. Give the wingers ideas on their decisions, such as a pass, cross, shot, continue dribbling to the end line, etc.

name: Circle Keep-Away Passing Game
description:
This keep-away game is a fun passing exercise for younger players that focuses on the passing game while playing keep away.














Circle Keep-Away Passing Game


keep-away passing game, soccer keep away, passing game


This keep-away game is a fun passing exercise for younger players that focuses on the passing game while playing keep away.
setup_text:
• With cones, mark off a circle with a 10-yard diameter.
• Designate two defenders in the middle of the circle holding a yellow pinny in their hands.
• Have the remaining players position themselves just inside the circle with one ball.
instructions_text:
• The two players in the middle will act as defenders while the rest of the circle will play keep away from these defenders.
• Start with the first pass being free.
• The attacking players can move about the circle in an attempt to maintain possession and string together passes.
• As a defender win the ball, they switch places with the offensive player that lost the ball to the defender. In this case, the defender drops the yellow pinny and join the attackers. The new defender grabs the yellow pinny and holds it in their hand.
• If the pass goes outside of the circle, the player that made the bad pass, or the player that did not properly trap the ball will take the place of the defender that has been in the middle the longest.
• If the attacking players put together ten passes, the defenders do a quick lap around the circle. The lap of shame, as we call it.
variations_text:
• Change the size of the circle to fit your player's age and skill level. Make the grid smaller to make the game harder for the attackers to keep possession, or make the grid larger to make the game a bit easier for the passers.
• Make the circle smaller for tighter and quicker passing.
• Limit the number of touches.
coaching_points_text:
• Clean, crisp passes.
• Good first-touch into space or towards the next pass.
• Good communication.
• Have fun.

name: Combination Play with Crossing and Finishing
description:
This crossing, finishing soccer drill is all about scoring goals. This drill is a great training tool to perfect crossing, finishing, and heading in soccer. 














Crossing, Finishing, Shooting Drill


Soccer Crossing and Finishing Shooting Drill


This crossing, finishing soccer drill is all about scoring goals. This drill is a great training tool to perfect crossing, finishing, and heading in soccer.
setup_text:
• Place a goalkeeper in a full-size goal.
• Assign your midfielders, flanks, and outside backs as servers on the penalty area's right and left sides.
• The remaining players create three additional lines in the middle of the field for the finishers who crash the box once the cross is prepped and ready to be served.
instructions_text:
• The right flank player dribbles to the end line on the coach's command and sends in a cross between 6 and 12 yards from goal.
• The players in the three finishing lines make curved runs and attack the near post, middle, and far post to finish on goal as quickly as possible.
• If the shooter is slow to shoot or receives the ball with their back facing the goal, they should play the ball to the centerline for a first-time shot on goal.
variations_text:
• Add defensive players as passive defenders.
• Add pressure as the players get comfortable with the passive defenders.
coaching_points_text:
• Make sure the server dribbles to the end line with speed, preps the ball towards the middle of the field to alert the attackers of the cross coming, and get hips turned towards goal before serving.
• Make sure the attacking finishers make curved runs to their spots to time their runs into the 6-12 yard area as the ball is arriving.
• Quick finish with a one-touch volley, header, or quick turn/shot.

name: Receiving the Ball with Back to Goal
description:
This soccer receiving drill will focus on chest, thigh, and fast traps and control. This receiving exercise teaches players to turn, shield, or play the way they face when their back is to the goal.














Receiving the Ball with Back to Goal


Soccer Trapping Drills, Soccer Control Ball Drill, Soccer Receiving Drill


This soccer receiving drill will focus on chest, thigh, and fast traps and control. This receiving exercise teaches players to turn, shield, or play the way they face when their back is to the goal.
setup_text:
• Create a grid approximately 20X30 yards.
• Create an 8-yard goal on the end line.
• A server (player 1) starts at the top of the grid.
• The attacker (player 2) starts about 5 yards in front of the goal facing the server.
• The defender (player 3) starts at the corner of the end line near the goal.
instructions_text:
• The server (player 1) plays a ball into the attacker (player 2).
• The defender (player 3) immediately puts the attacker (player 2) under pressure.
• The attacker must check-in by moving towards the pass.
• The attacker then decides to: a) turn and beat the defender (1v1) and have a shot on goal. b) play the ball back to the server and play 2v1.
variations_text:
• Quality touch to control the ball and turn, shield, or pass back to the server.
• Quick control and move towards the goal.
• First-touch is into space away from the advancing player.
• controlling player must decide to pass or dribble
• Control the ball properly
coaching_points_text: • Introduce additional players

name: 2v1, Receiving While Facing the Defender
description:
This soccer ball control drill aims to work on trapping and control with the foot, thigh, and chest while facing an opponent.














2v1, Receiving while Facing the Defender


Soccer Trapping Drill, Trap Facing Defender, Soccer Control Drills


This soccer ball control drill aims to work on trapping and control with the foot, thigh, and chest while facing an opponent.
setup_text:
• Create an area of approximately 20X30 yards.
• Divide the team into groups of three players.
• Start with one player (player 1) on one side of the grid.
• The other two players (player 2 and 3) start on the opposite side of the area.
• Player 1 starts with the ball.
instructions_text:
• Player 1 will serve the ball into player 2. Player 1 follows the pass and defends player 2.
• Player 2 moves towards the service, has a quality controlling touch away from the pressure from player 1, and attacks the end line player 1 started.
• Player 2 can pass to player 3, creating a 2v1.
• To score, stop the ball on the end line the two players are attacking.
• The server should serve the balls to the chest, thigh, and feet.
variations_text:
• Place a 2nd defender about 5-7 yards behind player 2 and 3 to pressure the attackers' backside.
• This defender should make a recovery run to get goal-side of the ball.
coaching_points_text:
• Quick control and move forward.
• The first touch is into space away from the advancing player.
• Controlling player must decide to pass or dribble
• Proper technique when controlling the ball (see links below)

name: Trapping With Passive Opposition
description:
This soccer trapping drill focus on trapping and control with the addition of a passive defender. The defender causes the receiving player to be more aware of their surroundings.














Trapping with Passive Opposition


Soccer Trapping Drill


This soccer trapping drill focus on trapping and control with the addition of a passive defender. The defender causes the receiving player tobe more aware of their surroundings.
setup_text:
• Set up players into groups of three.
• Assign one player as a server, one player as a receiver working on control and trapping, and one player as a passive defender.
• The server starts 10 yards from the receiver and defender.
instructions_text:
• The server plays a ball into the receiving player.
• The passive defender stands close enough to touch the receiving player and tries to distract the receiving player.
• The passive defender should not attempt to win the ball at this point.
• The server should play to the chest, thigh, or feed as specified by the coach. Serves to the chest and thigh should be thrown underhanded, and trapping with the feet should be served by the feet.
• After the ball is trapped and under control, the receiving player should playback to the server and repeat.
variations_text:
• Allow the defender to apply minimal pressure.
• Increase defensive pressure
coaching_points_text:
• Review each of these coaching points:
• How to Trap with the Chest
• How to Trap with the Thigh
• How to Trap with the Inside of the foot
• How to Trap with the Outside of the Foot
• How to Trap with the Instep of the Foot
• How to Trap with the Sole of the Foot

name: Trapping and Control With No Opposition
description:
This soccer skills drill aims to practice trapping and control with the foot, chest, and thigh.














Trapping and Control with No Opposition


How to Trap in Soccer, Trapping Soccer Drill, Control Soccer Drill,


This soccer skills drill aims to practice trapping and control with the foot, chest, and thigh.
setup_text:
• Split the team into two groups about 5-10 yards apart.
• The distance between the players will vary based on their skill level.
• Move players closer if they are beginners and further apart for more advanced players.
instructions_text:
• One player serves the ball to his partner, who traps and controls the ball with the part of the body specified by the coach.
• Inside of foot traps and control
• Outside of foot traps and control
• The instep of foot traps and control
• Sole of foot traps and control
• Thigh traps and control
• Chest traps and control
• When serving the ball to the thigh or chest, throw the ball underhand.
• Balls served to the foot should be passed.
• Advanced players can play the chest and thigh traps with their feet.
variations_text:
• Change the distance between players.
• Serve balls with the foot.
coaching_points_text:
• Review each of these coaching points:
• How to Trap with the Chest
• How to Trap with the Thigh
• How to Trap with the Inside of the foot
• How to Trap with the Outside of the Foot
• How to Trap with the Instep of the Foot
• How to Trap with the Sole of the Foot

name: 4v4 + Target Players With 2 Goals
description:
The 4v4 + Target Players to 2 Goals is a great 4v4 soccer game that teaches players to play into their target player. This game adds a more realistic twist to the typical 4-on-4 soccer game.














4v4 + Target Players with 2 Goals


4v4, 4 vs 4, 4 on 4, soccer


This is a great 4v4 soccer game that teaches players to play into their target player. This adds a more realistic twist to the normal 4 on 4 soccer game.
setup_text:
• Create a field that is suitable for 4vs.4 soccer game that is approximately 30X40 yards.
• With cones, flags, or training sticks, create two windows about 5 yards wide on the right and left side of the end line.
• Split the players into two teams of five. Set up a 4vs4 inside the grid.
• The additional player will be the target player who will start on the end line outside the cones they are attacking.
• The coach needs to have a supply of balls close for this 4v4 soccer game.
instructions_text:
• The coach starts the 4v4 soccer game by playing into one of the teams.
• To score the attacking team target player must receive a pass through one of the two windows and maintain possession.
• Once a goal is scored, the attacking player who made the initial pass to the target player switches roles and becomes the new target player.
• The defending team takes possession of the ball, and the game continues.
• The first team to 10 goals wins.
variations_text:
• Add a third window in the center of the end line.
• If you want to focus on target players, you might instruct the players not to rotate and allow one player to work as a target player longer.
coaching_points_text:
• 4 vs. 4 Offense Game:
• Vision - players should get their heads up and look up to read the game with their eyes. Player's heads should be on a constant pivot.
• Communication - make sure players are communicating both verbally and non-verbally.
• Support - make sure players are using the entire playing area (width and length) to get into good supporting angles. Create passing options that allow the receiving players the most time and space.
• Appropriate use of 1st touch
• Appropriate use of short or long passing
• Changes in the direction and speed of play
• Create goal scoring opportunities
• 4 vs. 4 Defensive Game:
• Good Defensive Principles - pressure, cover, balance
• Get as many people behind the ball as possible
• Good communication

name: Team Reaction Dribbling Drill
description:
The team reaction dribbling drill is a fun soccer dribbling drill that focuses on dribbling and reacting to teammates.














Team Reaction Dribbling Drill


Team Reaction Dribbling Drill, Soccer Dribbling Drill


The team reaction dribbling drill is a fun soccer dribbling drill that focuses on dribbling and reacting to teammates.
setup_text:
• Create a small grid approximately 20X20 yards.
• From each of the four corners, place a training stick or flag about 7-10 yards from the corner cone.
• Players start inside the grid with a ball each.
instructions_text:
• Instruct the players to free-dribble inside the grid using the entire space.
• When the coach calls out a player’s name, that player picks one of the four flags to dribble around and quickly dribbles around that flag.
• The entire team must also dribble with speed around the same flag as quickly as possible.
• The last player back into the grid must do push-ups or sit-ups.
variations_text:
• Assign the player’s numbers and call out the player’s number rather than their name.
• Call out a player’s name or their number, and the leader should pick a flag to run around. The rest of the group should run around the diagonally opposite flag.
coaching_points_text:
• Lift head, eyes up
• Close control
• Good control of body movements
• Use all parts of their feet while dribbling (inside, outside, top, bottom).
• Change of direction
• Change of pace
• Find space
• Dribble with speed

name: 2v2+1 (2 vs. 2 Plus Target Attacker)
description:
This shooting warm-up drill will focus on long-range passing, accuracy, and finishing. It can also be used as a fitness exercise by manipulating the numbers.














Shooting Warmup


Soccer Shooting and Finishing Warm up Soccer Drill


This soccer shooting drill is a great warm-up that focuses on long range passing, accuracy, finishing, and fitness drill.
setup_text:
• Divide the team up into 3 equal teams.
• Place cones at the top of the 18 and in each corner of the 18.
• Each player begins with a ball, and they are responsible for that ball.
• Each group numbers themselves off from 1 to x players and must shoot in that order.
instructions_text:
• Exercise #1: Shoot the ball into the goal, and the ball must hit the back of the net in the air. It cannot bounce before it goes in the goal.
• Exercise #2: Hit the crossbar
• Each exercise lasts for 4 minutes or the first to complete the activity 10 times.
• The players are responsible for keeping the same ball throughout this exercise and must shoot and retrieve their own ball.
• Players must shoot in the correct order as assigned. So, for example, if #1 shoots over the goal they must retrieve the ball and get back to the line as soon as possible because if 2 through 6 have already gone the group must wait until #1 gets back and go in order.
• The teams can shoot as fast as they want just as long as they are using their assigned ball in the correct order. After a shot, that player must quickly get their ball and get back to be ready for their next opportunity.
• After 4 minutes the team with the most executed exercises or 10 perfectly executed skills is awarded a win and teams rotate to a different cone/angle.
• The team with the most wins does not have to pay the penalty (push-ups, sit-ups, sprints, etc.).
• Exercise #1: Shoot the ball into the goal, and the ball must hit the back of the net in the air. It cannot bounce before it goes in the goal.
• Exercise #2: Hit the crossbar
variations_text:
• You can do this same exercise a number of different ways:
• Volley out of hands
• Half-volley out of hands
• Juggle 2 times and volley
• Get creative and have fun
• Can be done with all ages
• The is a good warm-up for the older age groups that have no problem hitting an 18-yard ball.
• For younger players, you may want them to take a touch or move the cones closer.
• You may have to warm-up up the younger age groups first because it takes little more for them to get the ball off the ground
coaching_points_text:
• Proper shooting  technique
• Focus on aiming for a particular area of the goal
• This is great to focus on leg strength for younger players.

name: 1v1 50/50 To Goal Team Competition
description:
This 1v1 soccer drill focuses on soccer fitness, scoring goals, shooting, goalkeeping, and winning 50-50 balls. This is a fun soccer drill for the younger soccer player.














1v1 50/50 to Goal Team Competition


1v1 Team Competition, 1 vs. 1 Soccer


This soccer drill focuses on soccer fitness, scoring soccer goals, soccer shooting, soccer goalkeeping, and winning 50-50 balls. This is a fun soccer drill for the younger soccer player.
setup_text:
• On a full-size goal, place a goalkeeper in the goal.
• Split the remaining players into two even teams and align them on each goal post.
• The first player in line must start with one hand on the goal post.
• Place a cone approximately 20 yards from the goal in front of each line.
• The coach should have a supply of soccer balls available.
instructions_text:
• On the coach’s command, the first player from each team should sprint around the cone in front of their line.
• As the players approach the cone, the coach plays a 50/50 ball in the middle of each cone.
• The two players fight for possession and quickly attack the goal.
• The players battle each other for the ball, and either player can score a goal after winning possession.
• Award the team scoring the goal a point.
• The first team to 10 points wins.
coaching_points_text:
• Players should be instructed to:
• Sprint at top speed around the cone
• Battle and win the 50/50 ball
• Quickly attack the goal once possession is won.
• Continue to fight for the ball when defending.
• Have fun.

name: Crossing, Finishing, Shooting Drill
description:
This is a great indoor soccer shooting drill to use while practicing indoors. This indoor soccer shooting drill also touches on dribbling, passing, using the walls, and finally shooting on goal.














Indoor Shooting Drill


Indoor Soccer Shooting Drill, Indoor Shooting Drill, Indoor Soccer Drill


This is a great indoor soccer shooting drill to use while practicing indoors. This indoor soccer shooting drill also touches on dribbling, passing, using the walls, and finally shooting on goal.
setup_text:
• Split the team into two even groups on opposite corners of the indoor soccer field.
• Everyone should have a ball.
• Place two goalkeepers in each of the goals.
• Set up four cones about 4-5 feet from the ball and about 5 yards apart along one side of the field, stretching about ¾ of the length of the field. These cones will be used for wall passes.
• On the opposite side of the field, set up 6-8 cones for the players to dribble through. These cones will be used to dribble through.
instructions_text:
• Wall Passes
• The players on the side set up for wall passes will dribble towards the first cone, knock the ball off the wall around the cone, collect the ball on the run and proceed to the next cone.
• This player continues until the last cone on their side is wall-passed around.
• Once the final cone is reached, the player should have one-touch towards the goal and then shoot on target.
• Switch lines after the shot.
• Dribble Through Cones
• The players on the side set up for dribbling through the cones should start at the same time the player on the wall passing line starts. This player dribbles in and out of the cones until they reach the end of the cones.
• At this point, the player passes to the coach, who plays the ball back to the player for a shot on goal.
• After the shot, they should switch lines, and the pattern should continue.
variations_text: • If you only have half of the indoor soccer field, modify the drill to wall-pass on sides, and dribble through the cones across the middle of the field and finish with a shot.
coaching_points_text:
• Focus on good control while dribbling through the cones.
• Good pace on the ball off the wall on the wall-pass.
• Quick touch and shot on target.

name: Goalkeeper - Arc Drill 1
description:
This soccer goalkeeper drill focuses on the keeper's proper footwork, stance, and movement along the goalkeeper arc.














Goalkeeper - Arc Drill 1


goalkeeper, keeper, goalie, soccer, drill, goalkeeper arc, arc, training


This soccer goalkeeper drill focuses on the keeper's proper footwork, stance, and movement along the goalkeeper arc.
setup_text:
• Place the keeper in a full-size goal.
• With cones or pennies, create the keeper arch for the keeper's visibility.
• Scatter 10 to 12 soccer balls within the penalty area.
instructions_text:
• The server should move quickly from ball to ball and shoot the ball on target.
• Instruct the goalkeeper to shuffle along the goalkeeper's arc, an arc 2-6 yards from the goal, and stay positioned between the ball and the goal along the arc.
• After saving the shot, the keeper should reset and prepare for the next shot.
variations_text: • Alternate between 2 servers alternating between each shot. This will challenge the keeper to move quickly from side to side along the arc to cut off the shooting angle.
coaching_points_text:
• The goalkeeper should keep their body positioned between the ball and the goal
• The keeper should never get caught on the goal line - they should stay 2-6 yards from the goal at all times
• The keeper should shuffle along the arc while not crossing their feet
• The goalkeeper should move quickly
• The keeper should have good hands when catching the shot.

name: Goalkeeper - Arc Drill 2
description:
This soccer goalkeeping drill is a great keeper drill designed to focus on the goalkeeper's movement along the goalkeeper's arc to keep the proper angle in the goal.














Goalkeeper - Arc Drill 2


goalkeeper arc, keeper, goalie,arc, soccer, drill, goalkeeper, training


This goalkeeper drill is a great goalkeeper drill designed to focus on the goalkeepers movement along the goalkeepers arc in order to keep proper angle in the goal.
setup_text:
• Place the keeper in a full-size soccer goal.
• Have 2-3 players start on one corner of the penalty area with a large supply of balls. These players will be the servers playing the ball into the goalkeeper.
instructions_text:
• Instruct the servers to dribble across the top of the penalty area.
• As the server dribbles across the penalty area, the goalkeeper must move along the imaginary goalkeeper's arc 2-6 yards from the goal line while keeping their body positioned between the goal and the ball.
• The dribbler can shoot at any point at their discretion.
• The keeper should make the save and quickly move in place along the arc for the next shooter.
coaching_points_text:
• The goalkeeper should shuffle feet quickly without crossing their feet
• The goalkeeper should keep good positioning on the arc between the ball and the goal
• The goalkeeper should keep a good distance of 2-6 yards from the goal line and never on the goal line.
• The keeper should move quickly

name: Goalkeeper - Side-To-Side
description:
This goalkeeper soccer drill focuses on the goalkeeper's side shuffle (side-to-side) movement and quickly getting up from the ground recovering from a dive.














Goalkeeper - Side-to-Side


goalkeeper, keeper, goalie, soccer, drill, side-to-side, movement, quickness, shuffle


This goalkeeper soccer drill focuses on the goalkeeper's side shuffle (side-to-side) movement and quickly getting up from the ground recovering from a dive.
setup_text:
• Place the keeper in a full-size goal.
• The coach should be about 8 yards from the goal line with a supply of soccer balls.
• Start with the goalkeeper shuffling side to side from post to post in the goal along the goal line.
instructions_text:
• Have the goalkeeper shuffle side to side, touching each of the goalposts.
• The keeper should drop to the ground in a push-up position on the coach's command and quickly jump back to the ready position.
• The coach then tosses a ball to the goalkeeper, who catches the ball returns it to the coach.
• Repeat for approximately 1 minute, then rest.
variations_text: • Instead of tossing the ball, knock a ball into the goalkeeper.
coaching_points_text:
• The keeper should shuffle quickly without crossing feet
• The keeper should get up quickly, get feet set and get ready for a shot
• The keeper should stay on their toes, leaning forward slightly to react to throw quickly.

name: Goalkeeper - Down Up Drill
description:
This goalkeeper drill focuses on helping the goalkeeper get up quickly from the ground and get set for a shot.














Goalkeeper - Down Up Drill


Soccer Goalkeeper Down Up Quickness


This goalkeeper drill is designed to help goalkeepers get up quickly from the ground and get set for a shot.
setup_text:
• Have the goalkeeper sits in the center of a full-size goal about 3-5 yards from the goal line.
• The coach/server should stand about 8-10 yards from the keeper with a supply of balls.
instructions_text:
• On the coach's command, the keeper should quickly stand, set their feet, get into the ready position to catch the ball.
• The coach tosses the ball towards an area of the goal.
• The keeper catches the ball and immediately returns the ball to the coach.
• The keeper returns to the seated position.
• Repeat this for 1 to 1 1/2 minutes.
coaching_points_text:
• Make sure the goalkeeper gets off the ground quickly.
• Make sure the keeper is aware of their position and location in front of the goal.
• The keeper should get set and ready themselves for the shot quickly.

name: Goalkeeper - Shooting Angle
description:
This Goalkeeping Shooting Angle Drill is excellent for improving Goalkeeper positioning and angles when handling shots. This drill focuses on correct footwork, proper angles, and quickly setting the goalkeeper's feet for the shot.














Goalkeeper - Shooting Angle


goalkeeper, shooting angle, footwork, quickness


Goalkeeping shooting angle drill for improving goalkeeper positioning and angles when defending a shot on goal.
setup_text:
• Place a goalkeeper in a full-size goal.
• Position 6-8 servers across the outer edge of the penalty area in front of the goal.
• Each server should start with a ball.
instructions_text:
• Alternate the servers one at a time.
• Each server will push the ball to the left, right, or straight at the goal, then shoot on goal.
• Instruct the goalkeeper to adjust their positioning according to the position of the ball. Their body should remain between the ball and the goal, with their hips facing the ball.
• The goalkeeper should then set their feet and get into their ready position and make the save.
• The goalkeeper should quickly set for the next shooter and repeat.
coaching_points_text:
• Good, Quick footwork (do not cross feet when shuffling)
• Right angle and positioning on moving ball - instruct them to stay between the ball and the goal
• Make sure they set their feet to get ready for the shot
• They should react quickly to the shot
• Make sure they catch the ball cleanly with good hands

name: Small-Sided Shooting and Finishing Game
description:
This control and trapping game is a great exercise that focuses on controlling balls out of the air. Players throw the balls into their teammates, making it easier to focus on controlling balls out of the air and deciding where to direct your touches.














Soccer Control and Trapping Small Sided Game


Soccer Control and Trapping Small Sided Game, Soccer Control, Soccer Trapping


This is a great exercise that focuses on control and trapping. It’s a great trapping drill that helps focus on when and where to receive the ball.
setup_text:
• Create a grid that is approximately 40X60 yards with goals on each end.
• Split the teams into 6v6 and place a goalkeeper in each goal.
• One team will start with the ball in their hands.
instructions_text:
• This trapping game is not your typical 6v6 game as you play this game with your hands.
• The play should follow this order:
• (1) a player throws to a teammate
• (2) the teammate (receiving player) must control the ball to the ground
• (3) the receiving player then picks up his trapped ball and throws it to a teammate.
• Players are not able to run while holding the ball.
• The opposition should attempt to intercept the ball by controlling the ball out of the air or picking up a poorly trapped ball from the other team.
• A goal can be stored at any point and from anywhere within the grid if the shot is taken immediately after controlling the ball to the ground.
coaching_points_text:
• Focus on how and where to trap the ball
• Make sure supporting players move off the ball to create space and avoid pressure.

name: Defensive Speed Course
description:
This soccer fitness drill is designed to improve defensive speed and quickness in front of the goal. This exercise is intended to be more of a fitness training drill than a technical or tactical defensive soccer training drill.














Defensive Speed Course


Soccer Defensive Speed Course Fitness Drill


The Defensive Speed Cource fitness drill is designed to improve defensive speed and quickness in front of the goal.
setup_text:
• Start by lining the defensive players up on the right corner of the 18-yard box.
• Set up six to eight 6" training hurdles approximately 2-yards apart.
• Mark off 5-yards and place a training stick.
• At a 45 degree angle away from the goal mark off another 5 yards from the last training stick and set another training stick.
• Set a third training stick approximately 5 yards directly towards the sideline from the last.
instructions_text:
• Instruct players to quickly double step over each training hurdle making sure each foot is placed in between each hurdle.
• Upon exiting the last training hurdle, the player should quickly sprint to the first training stick.
• Player's should then make a quick 45 degree cut around the first training stick and head towards the 2nd training stick.
• Upon approaching the 2nd training stick the player should make another 45 degrees cut and head towards the last training stick.
• The player should make a 90 degree cut around the last training stick and sprint towards the top of the 6-yard box.
• As the player starts their spring towards the 6-yard box the coach should play a ball (bouncing or on the ground) towards the goal and the defensive player must quickly maintain possession and distribute the ball to the coach who is near the sideline nearest the line of defenders.
variations_text:
• Have a player cross from the outside, without offensive pressure, allowing the defender to handle crossed balls while traveling towards their own goal.
• With a player crossing the ball from the outside, send the attacker through the cource two hurdles ahead of the defensive player, with the attempt to not allow the attacker to score from the cross.
coaching_points_text:
• quickness
• fast feet
• good speed
• quick cuts
• sharp turns
• haul booty

name: 2v2 Dribbling To Beat The Defender
description:
The 2v2 Dribbling to Beat the Defender soccer dribbling drill helps players recognize when to dribble, pass, or get off a shot once they beat the first defender.














2v2 Dribbling to Beat the Defender


2v2 Attacking, 2v2 Soccer Dribbling Drill, Dribble to Beat the Defender


This 2vs2 soccer dribbling drill helps players recognize when to dribble, pass, or get off a shot once the first defender is beaten.
setup_text:
• Create a 30X10 yard grid and divide it into 3 10X10 grids.
• Two attackers start at the top of the grid with one defender should start on the side of the 1st middle line, and another defender starts on the opposite side of the next line.
• A goal with a goalkeeper should be placed at the end line.
• You can also use a Pugg Goal in place of the larger goal and goalkeeper.
instructions_text:
• Instruct player "A" to pass to player "B" and attack the goal on the opposite goal line.
• Player "C" and "D" become active when the 1st pass is made from Player "A" to player "B."
• Player "C" is limited to grid "1" and player "D" is limited to defend grid "2".
• Player "A" and "B" must combine efforts and the player in possession must be willing to take more risks.
• The supporting player must offer sufficient support angles and distance to the player in possession.
• The attacking player can take a shot once a defender is beaten.
• Coaches should encourage players to beat the defender and finish with a shot.
variations_text:
• Use the Pugg Goal in place of the larger goal and goalkeeper
• Remove grid restrictions on defenders.
coaching_points_text:
• Approach when on the dribble
• Changing direction to beat the defender
• Change pace after change of direction to get past the defender
• Supporting player must help the player in possession
• Finish with a shot

name: 2v1 Dribbling With Opposition
description:
This 1v1 dribbling exercise allows coaches to focus on the 1st attacker's ability to beat the defender on the dribble. In this soccer drill, the coach should focus on the attacker's approach, make sure the attacker has a change in direction, and finish with a burst of speed (change of pace). This drill helps beginners get a feel for moving around defenders.














1v1 1st Attacker Dribbling Without Opposition


1v1 1st Attacker Dribbling Without Opposition Dribbling Drill


This 1v1 dribbling exercise allows coaches to focus on the 1st attacker's ability to beat the defender on the dribble.
setup_text:
• Split the team into groups of two.
• Each group will face each other about 7-10 yards apart.
• One person from each group starts with a ball.
instructions_text:
• Have the defenders start the exercise by playing a ball to the attacker's feet.
• The defender then takes a step towards the approaching attacker, but not to defend.
• The attacker should control the ball, move towards the defender, make a "fake," change the ball's direction and change their pace to quickly leave the defender.
• It is essential to make sure the defender is passive and not attempts to steal the ball at this development stage.
• The two players move 5-7 yards apart and reverse the roles, so each player plays offense and defense.
variations_text: • Let the defender apply a little pressure on the attacker by stepping in front of the attacker as they change direction.
coaching_points_text:
• Good controlling touch
• Quality approach with the right amount of speed and control
• Make sure the attacker dribbles directly at the defender.
• Have the player "fake" by stepping over the ball, having a hard step, stutter-step, dragging a foot or toe, dipping their shoulders, faking a kick, or using their eyes to look in a direction opposite of where they are going.
• Good change of direction once a fake is made to move away from the defender.
• Good change-of-pace to leave the defender once they have them off-balanced from the fake and change of direction.

name: Shadow Dribbling
description:
This shadow soccer dribbling drill uses partners who do not attempt to gain possession of the ball but adds extra pressure as they follow the dribbler around and tries to imitate the lead dribblers every move.














Shadow Dribbling


Soccer Dribbling, Shadow Dribbling Drill


The shadow soccer dribbling drill uses partners who do not attempt to steal the ball, but adds extra pressure as they follow the dribbler.
setup_text:
• Create a small grid approximately 20X20 yards.
• Instruct players to pair up each player with a soccer ball.
instructions_text:
• The lead dribbler dribbles around inside the grid while the shadow dribbler attempts to mimic the lead dribbler's every move by keeping a good close distance.
• Change leaders after a minute.
coaching_points_text:
• lift head, eyes up
• close control
• control of body movements
• use all parts of their feet while dribbling (inside, outside, top, bottom).
• change of direction
• change of pace
• find space
• dribble with speed
• encourage players to be creative

name: Speed of Play Warm-Up
description:
This is a passing warm-up drill that is a great start to every practice and before a game. Players will get a lot of touches on the ball and can focus on receiving and passing while getting in a good warm-up.














Passing Warm-up Drill


Passing Warm-up Drill


This is a passing warm-up drill that is a great start to every practice and before a game.
setup_text:
• Split the team into groups of two players with one ball per group.
• Set cones up creating a 5-yard passing lane about 10 yards apart.
• Set a different color cone about 5-yards from the passing lane creating a triangle.
• Players position themselves between the passing lane across from their partner.
instructions_text:
• In this warmup drill, run through a few of these variations for 3-4 minutes each.
• Players start with two-touch passes to one another. Players should be on the balls of their feet and moving.
• Players play in two-touches, but this time, immediately after making a pass, the passer alternates moving around the cones to their right and left.
• Players play in two-touches; immediately after making a pass, the passer touches their chest to the ground and quickly returns to their feet to receive the next pass.
• Players play in two-touches; immediately after making a pass, the passer turns and runs around the cone behind them and check-in to the middle of the cones to receive the next pass.
• Players play in two-touches; immediately after making a pass, the passer touches their butts to the ground and quickly returns to their feet to receive the next pass.
• Players play in two-touches; immediately after making a pass, the passer moves backward to the cone and checks-in to the middle of the cones to receive the next pass.
• Players play in one-touch passes.
variations_text: • Be creative and add other activities to mix things up.
coaching_points_text:
• Quality first touches, keeping the ball in front of the players.
• Communication between the two players.
• Good pace on the pass
• Good accuracy of the pass

name: 1v1, 1v2, 2v2 - 4 Goal Game
description:
This drill encourages players to recognize attacking opportunities by creating space, making quick decisions, and choosing the best option between two goals. Defensively, players learn to cover space effectively and transition quickly.














3v3, 4-Goal Small-Sided Game  Funino


Funino, small-sided game, youth soccer, decision-making, attacking play


A 4-goal small-sided game designed to develop decision-making, movement, and attacking principles in a fun, game-like environment.
setup_text:
• Field Size: 20x30 yards
• Goals: 4 small goals (two at each end, spaced apart)
• Players: 3v3 or 4v4 (adjust as needed)
• Ball Supply: Multiple soccer balls to keep play flowing
instructions_text:
• Divide players into two teams. Each team defends two goals and attacks the other two.
• The play starts with a pass-in from the coach.
• Players score by finishing into either of the two attacking goals.
• Encourage quick transitions between attack and defense.
• No goalkeepers; all players must stay involved in the play.
• Play in 3-5 minute rounds and rotate players as needed.
variations_text:
• Limited Touches: Restrict players to 2 or 3 touches to promote quick passing.
• Directional Play: Add a rule that players must make a pass into a specific zone before scoring.
• Conditioned Defending: Assign one player as a designated defender who cannot score.
• Time Limit: Require teams to score within a set time after gaining possession.
• Overload Play: Introduce a neutral player to create a 4v3 advantage for the attacking team.
coaching_points_text:
• Encourage players to recognize open space and switch play quickly.
• Promote fast decision-making and attacking movement off the ball.
• Defenders should cover both goals effectively and communicate.
• Keep the game flowing with quick restarts to maximize touches.
• Emphasize teamwork and movement to create scoring opportunities.

name: Lane Spacing and Separation Soccer Game
description:
This 1v1 soccer attacking drill focuses on the attacker making quick faints, a change of direction, and a burst of speed while causing the defender to react quickly to the attacker's movements.














1v1 Attacking and Reaction Drill


1v1 Soccer; Attacking and Reaction Drill


This 1v1 soccer attacking drill focuses on the attacker making quick faints, a change of direction, and a burst of speed while causing the defender to react quickly to the attacker's movements.
setup_text:
• Create a grid approximately 40 yards wide and 30 yards long.
• Place a small goal or Pugg Goal on each end line.
• Place four cones in each corner of the field approximately 5 yards from the sideline.
• Split the team into two groups.
• One group on one sideline will be the defenders.
• The other group on the other sideline will be the attackers and should start with a supply of soccer balls.
instructions_text:
• The first attacker in the line passes to the first defender across the field.
• These two players should move towards the center of the grid about 5 yards apart and continue to pass back and forth.
• On the attackers' queue, he can take off and attack either of the two small goals.
• The defender, not knowing which way he will go should react quickly to the attacker's movements.
• The attacker can fake and feint and go the other direction at any time.
• Once a goal is scored or the ball goes out of bounds, the two players must run around the cone closest to the goal they are attacking on their side of the field and sprint to the cone near the opposite goal.
• The drill repeats with the next attacker and defender.
• Have players switch lines so they have the opportunity to attack and defend.
variations_text: • Instead of playing the pass in the beginning, have the defenders play a ball into the attackers and let the attackers attacking the goal immediately. With this variation, the defender must close the attacker down quickly.
coaching_points_text:
• The attacker should use feints, change of direction, and speed to confuse the defender.
• The defender should react quickly and close the attacker down.

name: Defensive Overlapping Drill
description:
This soccer fitness drill is designed to improve defensive speed and quickness in front of the goal. This exercise is intended to be more of a fitness training drill than a technical or tactical defensive soccer training drill.














Defensive Speed Course


Soccer Defensive Speed Course Fitness Drill


The Defensive Speed Cource fitness drill is designed to improve defensive speed and quickness in front of the goal.
setup_text:
• Start by lining the defensive players up on the right corner of the 18-yard box.
• Set up six to eight 6" training hurdles approximately 2-yards apart.
• Mark off 5-yards and place a training stick.
• At a 45 degree angle away from the goal mark off another 5 yards from the last training stick and set another training stick.
• Set a third training stick approximately 5 yards directly towards the sideline from the last.
instructions_text:
• Instruct players to quickly double step over each training hurdle making sure each foot is placed in between each hurdle.
• Upon exiting the last training hurdle, the player should quickly sprint to the first training stick.
• Player's should then make a quick 45 degree cut around the first training stick and head towards the 2nd training stick.
• Upon approaching the 2nd training stick the player should make another 45 degrees cut and head towards the last training stick.
• The player should make a 90 degree cut around the last training stick and sprint towards the top of the 6-yard box.
• As the player starts their spring towards the 6-yard box the coach should play a ball (bouncing or on the ground) towards the goal and the defensive player must quickly maintain possession and distribute the ball to the coach who is near the sideline nearest the line of defenders.
variations_text:
• Have a player cross from the outside, without offensive pressure, allowing the defender to handle crossed balls while traveling towards their own goal.
• With a player crossing the ball from the outside, send the attacker through the cource two hurdles ahead of the defensive player, with the attempt to not allow the attacker to score from the cross.
coaching_points_text:
• quickness
• fast feet
• good speed
• quick cuts
• sharp turns
• haul booty

name: Dribbling to Beat Defenders, Take on Defenders
description:
This drill teaches players how to turn effectively when under defensive pressure. It improves awareness, body positioning, and ball protection while developing confidence in 1v1 situations.














Dribbling and Turning with Pressure on the Back


Dribbling under pressure, shielding, turning, ball control, 1v1 play


A 1v1 drill that focuses on turning under pressure, shielding the ball, and making quick decisions to beat a defender and retain possession.
setup_text:
• Field Size: 20x15 yards
• Players: Pairs, each with a ball
• Roles:
• Dribbler: Starts in front with legs spread wide, ready to receive the ball
• Defender: Stands behind the dribbler, ready to pass the ball through their legs
instructions_text:
• On the coach’s command, the defender passes the ball through the dribbler’s legs.
• The dribbler, without looking back, must quickly locate the ball and attempt to turn and face the defender.
• If the dribbler has space, they should quickly turn and accelerate towards the starting point.
• If the defender applies immediate pressure, the dribbler must use their body to shield the ball and find an opportunity to turn.
• The dribbler must reach the starting point while keeping possession of the ball.
• Once they reach the starting side, players switch roles and repeat.
variations_text:
• Directional Passing: Allow defenders to pass the ball slightly left or right to challenge dribbler reactions.
• Time Limit: Require dribblers to turn and reach the starting spot within 5-7 seconds.
• Weak Foot Challenge: Dribblers must turn and dribble using only their weaker foot.
• Add a Recovery Defender: After passing, the defender must chase and try to win the ball before the dribbler reaches the starting area.
• Limited Touches: Dribblers must turn and reach the starting point using a set number of touches.
• This drill improves a player's ability to turn under pressure, protect the ball, and make quick decisions in tight spaces—essential skills for real-game situations.
coaching_points_text:
• This drill improves a player's ability to turn under pressure, protect the ball, and make quick decisions in tight spaces—essential skills for real-game situations.
• Awareness: Dribblers must scan quickly and decide when to turn or shield.
• Use of Body Position: Dribblers should use their body and arms to protect the ball.
• Effective Turning Techniques: Encourage inside hook, outside hook, and drag-back turns.
• Defensive Pressure: Defenders should apply realistic pressure without fouling.
• Explosive Acceleration: Once turned, dribblers should accelerate into space to escape pressure.

name: Dribbling with Speed, Recognizing When to Dribble
description:
In this 2v1 Dribbling with Opposition dribbling drill, we put the players in a 2v1 situation forcing the players to decide whether they should dribble or pass.














2v1 Dribbling with Opposition


2v1 to Goal, Attacking on the dribble, 2v1 Soccer Dribbling with Opposition Drill


In this dribbling drill, we put the players in a 2v1 situation forcing the players to decide whether they should dribble or pass.
setup_text:
• Create a 30X15 yard grid.
• Split the grid in half with disk cones to make two adjacent grids touching on one side.
• Place two attackers on one side of the grid.
• The full-size goal and goalkeeper is on the end line opposite the attackers.
• A single defender should be placed on the side of the middle line.
• You can use a Pugg Goal in place of the larger goal and goalkeeper.
instructions_text:
• The first attacking player plays to the second attacking player.
• Once the pass is made, the defender becomes active and defends the attacking players.
• The defender is only allowed to defend in the 1st grid.
• Instruct the attacking players to take on the defender and attempt to score a goal.
• The attacker in control must decide whether he should pass or dribble.
variations_text: • Use a Pugg Goal in place of the larger goal and goalkeeper.
coaching_points_text:
• Good choice to pass, dribble or shoot
• Close Control
• Change of Direction
• Change of pace

name: Soccer Pass and Move Drill
description:
This passing and moving combination soccer drill focuses on crisp, clean passing, timing, movement off the ball, and the speed of play.














Combination - Pass and Move


Soccer Combination Play, Pass and Move


This passing and moving combination soccer drill focuses on crisp, clean passing, timing, movement off the ball, and the speed of play.
setup_text:
• Place a cone at the four corners of a grid approximately 30x20 yards. Adjust the size of the grid based on age, skill, and length of combination play.
• Place a cone on the about 10 yards from two diagonal corners as shown in the diagram.
• Stagger a cone about 7 yards from the cone on the side on each corner as shown in the diagram.
• Have a player at each cone with the balls starting in the two corners.
instructions_text:
• Player 1 passes to Player 2 and moves to Player 2's cone.
• Player 2 passes to Player 3.
• Player 3 passes back to Player 2.
• Player 3 passes to Player 4.
• Player 2 moves to Player 3's cone.
• Player 3 moves to Player 4's cone.
• Player 4 dribbles with speed to the other Player 1's cone.
• The drill repeats.
variations_text:
• Switch directions of the play to work on different angles and passes.
• Same as above, except play a long ball to player 1 instead of dribbling to them.
coaching_points_text:
• Focus on crisp, clean passes.
• Movement off the ball must be timed with the pass.
• The drill should flow with a continuous passing pattern.
• Focus on speeding up the combination play.

name: 1v1 to Goal
description:
This soccer shooting fitness exercise is a great finishing drill for getting rapid shots on multiple goals and is also great for fitness.














Three Goal Shooting Drill


 3 goal shooting drill, three goal shooting drill, shooting fitness


This soccer shooting fitness exercise is a great finishing drill for getting rapid shots on multiple goals and is also great for fitness.
setup_text:
• You will need half of a field with a full-size goal.
• Set two portable goals on each sideline about 15 yards from midfield.
• You will be using all three goals for this drill.
• Put a goalkeeper in each of the three goals.
• The rest of the team starts at midfield, each player with a ball.
• Place the remaining balls at each of the three goals.
instructions_text:
• The first player in line dribbles toward the right sideline goal and takes a shot on goal.
• The keeper then distributes the ball to the outside of the cone towards the primary goal.
• The shooter receives the ball from the keeper and shoots on the primary goal.
• The next keeper then distributes the ball to the outside of the cone towards the left goal.
• The shooter receives the ball from the keeper and shoots on the left goal.
• The keeper then distributes the ball around the cone towards midfield.
• The shooter receives the ball and dribbles to midfield to the back of the line.
• The next player in line starts once the goalkeeper on the right side distributes the ball to the shooter.
variations_text:
• Change directions.
• Make players use opposite foot.
coaching_points_text:
• Speed of play
• Good shot on goal
• Shooting form

name: Improving Combination Play
description:
This combination passing drill is designed to work on combination play while advancing up the field. This passing drill focuses on the timing of passes, runs, combination play, and will be a great warm-up to passing practices.














Line Passing Combination Warm-up


Line Passing Combination Warm-up, Passing Soccer Drill


This combination passing drill is designed to work on combination play while advancing up the field.
setup_text:
• Start with four cones set along a sideline about 10 yards apart.
• The player on one of the far cones starts with the ball.
instructions_text:
• Player 1 passes into Player 2 who returns the ball back to player 1.
• Player 1 then passes to Player 3 who returns the pass to Player 2.
• Player 2 then passes to Player 4 who returns the pass to Player 3.
• Player 3 then passes back to Player 4 who passes to Player 2.
• The pattern is repeated as the players move in a straight line down the field.
• Instruct the players to keep the same distance as much as possible when moving down the field.
• When a groups reach the other side of the field have them wait until all groups have completed.
• Have the players repeat this pattern going to the other side of the field.
• Repeat a few times to allow the players to warm-up and get into a rhythm.
coaching_points_text:
• Focus on crisp clean passes with the right amount of pace.
• Slightly lead the player so they receive the ball as they are advancing down the field.
• Communication is important so each player is aware of the next move.

name: Attack vs. Defence Shooting and Defending Drill
description:
This 2v2 soccer attacking and defending drill focuses on the attacker's decision to dribble, pass, or shoot. From the defensive side, they must quickly close down the attackers and deny space.














2v2 Battle - Attacking and Defending Drill


2v2 Soccer Battle, Soccer Attacking, Soccer Defending


This 2v2 soccer attacking and defending drill focuses on the attacker's decision to dribble, pass, or shoot. From the defensive side, they must quickly close down the attackers and deny space.
setup_text:
• Create a 40X30 grid. The grid should be wider than longer.
• Place a small goal or Pugg Goal on each end line.
• Split the team into two groups.
• Have one group start on the sideline without a ball; they will be the attackers.
• The other group will start on the opposite sideline with a ball; they are the defenders.
instructions_text:
• Two defenders step out with one ball.
• Two attackers also step out without a ball.
• The defender with the ball passes to one of the attackers.
• The defenders quickly move to close down the two attackers.
• The attackers must immediately start with a pass to the second attacker. Encourage deception such as overlapping runs from the attackers to throw off the approaching defenders.
• The attackers can attack either of the two goals.
• Once a goal is scored, the ball goes out of bounds, or the defensive team wins the ball, the play is over and the next group begins.
• The drill repeats with two new defenders and two new attackers.
• Switch the roles of each line to allow the opportunity to attack and defend.
variations_text:
• Modify the field size to play 3v3.
• Limit the touches of the attackers to encourage more passing and 1-2's.
coaching_points_text:
• Attackers
• Encourage attackers to work together to quickly and effectively attack the goal and score quickly.
• Continuous movement to assist your teammate.
• Make the right decision to either dribble to beat a defender, pass, or shoot.
• Defenders
• Quickly close down the attackers to deny space.
• Continue working hard until the ball is won.
• Proper body mechanics while defending to hold off the attackers.

name: Improving Speed of Play - Passing Drill
description:
This passing warm-up drill will focus on accuracy when passing with the inside of the foot. 














Inside of the Foot Passing Warm-up


inside of the foot passing warm-up


This warm-up drill focuses on passing with the inside of the foot.
setup_text:
• Create a small window with two cones approximately 4 yards apart.
• Split the team evenly into two groups.
• Each group should line up about 6 yards from the passing window.
• The play in front of one of the lines should start with the ball.
instructions_text:
• The first player in line passes the ball through the window to the first player in the other line.
• The passing player then follows their pass to the back of the other line by sprints outside the window.
• The receiving player then takes a touch then plays the ball back through the window to the next player in the other line.
• The passing player then follows their pass to the back of the other line.
• Repeat.
coaching_points_text:
• Clean first touch
• Toe up, ankle locked
• Strike the ball smoothly with the inside of the foot
• Good pace on the ball
• Focus on accuracy between the cones

name: Goalkeeper Warm-Up Drill
description:
This goalkeeper drill focuses on helping the goalkeeper get up quickly from the ground and get set for a shot.














Goalkeeper - Down Up Drill


Soccer Goalkeeper Down Up Quickness


This goalkeeper drill is designed to help goalkeepers get up quickly from the ground and get set for a shot.
setup_text:
• Have the goalkeeper sits in the center of a full-size goal about 3-5 yards from the goal line.
• The coach/server should stand about 8-10 yards from the keeper with a supply of balls.
instructions_text:
• On the coach's command, the keeper should quickly stand, set their feet, get into the ready position to catch the ball.
• The coach tosses the ball towards an area of the goal.
• The keeper catches the ball and immediately returns the ball to the coach.
• The keeper returns to the seated position.
• Repeat this for 1 to 1 1/2 minutes.
coaching_points_text:
• Make sure the goalkeeper gets off the ground quickly.
• Make sure the keeper is aware of their position and location in front of the goal.
• The keeper should get set and ready themselves for the shot quickly.

name: Jam-Packed Soccer Dribbling Drill
description:
This 5v5 soccer dribbling game is more of a realistic setting to help focus on improving dribbling skills. Because of a large number of players, players are forced to make decisions to dribble, pass, or shoot.














5v5 Dribbling Game


Dribble to beat a defender, 5v5 Soccer Dribbling Practice Game


5v5 soccer dribbling game is more of a realistic setting to help focus on improving dribbling skills.
setup_text:
• Create a grid that is 30X40 yards.
• Divide the players into two teams of 5 field players and one goalkeeper.
• Create a goal on each goal line, or use two Pugg Goals on each end line.
instructions_text:
• Players play a 5v5 game with the restriction that the attacking player with the ball must first beat a defender before he can pass or shoot.
• This restriction will encourage attackers to dribble and take on defenders.
variations_text: • Remove all of the restrictions and play a standard 5v5 game.
coaching_points_text:
• Encourage players to take on defenders.
• Remind players to make a good approach, change direction and change pace.
• Players must make decisions to dribble, pass or shoot.

name: Soccer Ball Smash
description:
This drill teaches players how to play accurate breaking balls into space and make well-timed runs to receive them. Players will work on combination play through quick 1-2 passes, then focus on the weight and timing of through balls. The receiving player learns when to make their run and how to time it with the pass. This drill builds the connection between passer and runner that's crucial in breaking down defenses during games.














Breaking Ball Combination Drill


breaking ball drill, through ball training, combination play soccer, off-ball movement drill


Players practice breaking balls between mannequins while making timed runs to receive passes in space for improved combination play.
setup_text:
• Set up three sticks or mannequins in a straight line, spacing them 4-5 yards apart
• Place a cone 7-10 yards away from the center mannequin on each side
• Position one player on each side of the center mannequin (these are your combination players)
• Split the remaining players evenly between the two cones
• Give a ball to each player at the cones
• For groups larger than 12 players, create a second identical setup to maximize touches
instructions_text:
• Player 1 at the cone passes to Player 2 standing near the center mannequin
• Player 2 plays a quick one-touch return pass back to Player 1
• As soon as Player 2 makes the return pass, they sprint around the outside of the left mannequin
• Player 1 plays a breaking ball between the left and center mannequins into the space where Player 2 is running
• Player 2 receives the ball on their run and passes it across to the player at the opposite cone
• Players rotate positions: Player 1 moves to the center, Player 2 goes to the back of the opposite cone line
• Run both sides at the same time, with all runs going to the left side initially
• After several repetitions, switch the pattern so runs go around the right mannequin instead
• If players struggle with both sides going simultaneously, run one side at a time until they understand the pattern
variations_text:
• Add a passive defender between the mannequins to make Player 1 disguise the breaking ball
• Require Player 2 to finish on a small goal after receiving the breaking ball
• Make the final pass to the opposite cone a specific type - driven, chipped, or outside of the foot
• Have Player 2 make a fake run to one side before cutting around the other mannequin
• Increase the distance between mannequins as players improve to work on longer breaking balls
• Add a time limit - see how many successful combinations each group can complete in 60 seconds
• Require two touches max for Player 2 when they receive the breaking ball before passing to the opposite cone
coaching_points_text:
• Watch the timing of the run - Player 2 should start moving the moment they return the pass, not before
• The breaking ball needs the right weight - not too hard, not too soft - so Player 2 can collect it in stride
• Player 1 should aim the pass into the space between mannequins, not directly at Player 2
• Player 2 needs to accelerate into the space, not jog - game speed runs create game speed habits
• Check that Player 2 opens their body to receive the ball on the correct foot based on which direction they're running
• Make sure players communicate - a simple call for the ball helps timing
• The first pass in the 1-2 should be firm and accurate to the feet
• Player 2's return pass should be one-touch when possible to speed up the combination

name: Quick Transition Game
description:
This is a fast-paced 1v1 game that focuses on quickly transitioning from the attack to defense.














1v1 Transition


1v1 Transition Soccer Drill


This is a fast-paced 1v1 game that focuses on quickly transitioning from the attack to defense.
setup_text:
• Create a grid approximately 25x25 yards.
